"A bug crawled into my eye while I was asleep! There it is!"

You can imagine her pointing an immense, accusatory finger your way as you land, impacting hard. Your miniscule mass protects you from too much pain or damage, and you look around to see where you have ended up.
12111111221112.title: Flicked Away

choices: Run for cover
Cling tight to Laura
121111112211121.content:
You push yourself to your hands and knees, the familiar rainbow pattern of the rug beneath you as Laura's voice thunders in the heavens above.

"I see it, Lou."

Vibrations shudder through the floor, and you turn your head groggily to see that Laura's massive feet - each one the size of an ocean liner - are now planted facing you, toes flexing in anticipation.

"Get up, get up, get up," you scream to yourself, willing your limbs to start working properly before you are crushed under the heel of the giantess.

The world lurches as the woman brings one foot up into the sky above you, the little light shed into the room by her desk-lamp blotted out by her shadow. You never thought that it would end like this.

No. It won't. You're not dead yet, damnit! You throw yourself to one side as the foot slams down beside you, bouncing you into the air with the impact.

"Did you get it?" Louise asks, and you wonder at her absent feet. Presumably, she's curled up on top of her bed, scared of creepy crawlies running around the floor.

Running around like you are now. Laura's foot missed you by millimetres, and if she tried again you are certain that you wouldn't survive. You should run for the safety offered by the underside of one of the beds, and hope that you can outdistance the giantess.

Alternatively, since Laura won't yet be sure that she's crushed you - given the darkness and distance - you could grab onto her foot as you did with Louise's earlier, and allow her to carry you away. Sure, there's a risk that she may feel or spot you, but there's more hope that she'll recognise you as human than if you're just another scurrying bug. Right?
121111112211121.title: Laura the Destroyer

choices: Scarper under the bed
Return to Louise's toes
1211111122111211.content:
You sprint falt-out away from Laura's foot, towards the yawning darkness beneath Louise's bed, paying no heed whatsoever to your surroundings. They would only distract you. You've got to concentrate on running as fast as possible.

"I got it," Laura's voice booms, "so you can stop hiding, you big wuss!"

"Hey, don't call me that!" Louise retorts.

Suddenly two more feet land in front of you, shuddering your world and throwing you to the ground. Louise must have stopped curling up in fear on her bed and stood up, and now she's between you and escape!

Hopefully the two giantesses are too caught up in their conversation to notice you now, but while the shelter of the underbed world looks very desirable right now, so too do Louise's massive toes, like a small village before you. The last time you were among them wasn't so bad, and maybe a second attempt to get her attention utilising them will go better now that you know what you're doing?
1211111122111211.title: Louise's Feet Again

choices: It's Laura - she moves to finish you off
It's Louise - she sreams and jumps away
12111111221112111.content:
No time to waste on foot gazing, no matter how sexy they may be. You run between Louise's legs, imagining that this is somewhat how it must have felt in ancient times, to pass the Colossus of Rhodes...

Even as the welcoming darkness of the underbed world beckons to you however, you can hear a gasp from the heights; one of the goddesses has noticed you!
12111111221112111.title: Colossus

12111111221112112.content:
Aw, you can't stay mad at those toes for long! Arms wide, you run forward to embrace the nearest (and smallest, hugging it tight in preparation for a lengthy climb.

Louise has other ideas.

Her scream splits the heavens, and the lashing of her leg catapults you away from her, tumbling again across her rainbow-coloured carpet. As your wits roll around your skull, you can hear the dull roar of the wrathful Laura as she returns to finish you off.

"Tough little bastard, eh? Well, survive THIS."

The sky is blacked out, and her bare heel descends. You're too dazed to avoid it this time, and submit helplessly to her oppressive weight as it presses her skin, flesh and bone down onto your inferior stock, splitting you open and splashing your innards about.
12111111221112112.title: Laura Always Gets her Target

choices: Try to get her attention
Try to hide
1211111122111212.content:
You reach out and grip onto Laura's skin, digging your fingers deep into the whorled pattern on the side of her foot. No sooner have you done this than it launches into the air, leaving you dangling behind as it inverts, flipping you over and almost wrenching your arms from their sockets.

"Let me check," Laura booms, and you soon realise what is happening. She's lifting her foot up, expecting to see your mangled remains on the underside. Now that she's flipped it, sole-upwards so that she can check it intimately, should you reveal yourself?

She's not in the most receptive of minds, and besides possibly falling over in shock she may crush you. However, at no other time are you going to be regarded so closely, so this may be your only chance.

The alternative would be to try to hide on the side of her foot until she's stopped checking, praying that she won't see you.
1211111122111212.title: Laura's Sole Inspection

choices: Cling to the finger
Jump to the floor
12111111221112121.content:
Get her attention. yeah, right. Quite hard while Laura is standing on one foot, meaning that the one you're clinging too isn't very steady, making your climbing both difficult and dangerous.

Still, with the giantess having an aerial view of the whole scene, all you've really got to do is reach her sole and she'll see you.

So it is that you scramble across her warm, pulsing flesh, taking in both its incredible smoothness and the rank odour of the sweat that has built up over the course of the night.

Since you're clinging tight, you can't look away from the surface to see Laura's face, and can't tell when she's spotted you.

Well, not visibly, anyway.

"I didn't quite kill it," she storms, "it's still crawling around on the side of my foot!"

"Ew! Like I would want to know that!" Louise's disgusted grunt comes from across the room.

"I'll just scrape it off and then we can get back to sleep, okay?" Laura says.

She's as good as her word. Her gigantic finger comes swooping in at you, smacking into the side of your body with the force of an express train. Clearly she hasn't recognised you for what you are. Should you grab for her finger in an attempt to get through to her again, from a closer perspective, or just go with the flow and drop, to try again later?
12111111221112121.title: Scraped

12111111221112122.content:
Oh yeah, hide on the foot of a woman who is, at this very moment, scouring said foot for the slightest sign of you? Good luck with that.

You scrunch up as small as you can, staying as still as possible, but still Laura somehow manages to spot you. She must have the eyes of a hawk, or something.

"Yup, got that sucker," she tells her room-mate, rubbing at the remains of the crushed insect with her nail, prying it off her foot.

You - aforementioned 'remains' - are mangled beyond recognition in the process, the tremendous muscles of the giantess pulping you beneath their implacable progress, before your utterly destroyed corpse bits are thrown to the floor, and Laura returns to bed to get some sleep.
12111111221112122.title: Destroyed

choices: Camp out here
Strike out for greener grasses
121111112211122.content:
You have come to rest on a thin ledge of white material, lying against a wall of the same colour. Above you, Laura's voice thunders, and your resting place shudders in time with her words.

"I see it, Lou."

A hand, similar in dimension to Louise's but sporting short, neatly trimmed nails, swoops into vision, ducking below you to tug at the end of the white wall, below you. Looking down, you see that the wall terminates at the top of an immense flesh-coloured pillar which leads down to a foot -

It's Laura's leg. You've landed on a crease in her shorts, which means -

Your thoughts are interrupted as Laura's hand pulls her shorts taut, removing the ledge upon which you rest and letting you drop into an abyss.

Once again you land hard, this time on a soft, warm surface. As you lie on your back and rotate your head slightly, you make out fingers at the periphery of your vision, clawing toward the sky...

You're resting in the palm of Laura's hand, and in the sky her ignorant face looks down at the 'insect' she's holding.

"Have you got it?" Louise yells from somewhere out of sight.

"Yes. I'll just take it outside, okay?" Laura replies, each small movement of her mouth during the speech horrific to you, as her gaping maw reveals monstrous teeth capable of rending your tiny form in twain with a single bite.

The hand cups, rolling you to a pit in her palm as her head moves out of sight, the giantess walking away. The immense creaking of the door as it opens into the student hall corridor is like a thousand roadworks.

Then comes the descent, and you are surprised as you remain sitting in the hand despite the incredible velocities. Then Laura's face returns, and you think that she may be about to offer you a respite as her she takes a deep breath.

Hot wind buffets you, blasting you off the palm and to the floor, which isn't that far away. You turn to see the mountain of Laura wave at you before it stands to its full height and closes the doorway of the gods, denying you access to their room and leaving you alone in the dark.

The floorboards continue to vibrate as Laura returns to her bed, and you struggle to come to terms with what to do next.

You could make your bed here, and sleep the night away, hopefully to find a more accepting pair of women come the morning (when they're not so drunk). Or, you could leave them to it, and explore the other residents of this place, one of whom may be able to help you.
121111112211122.title: Laura Blows

choices: Hop aboard Laura's sandal
Scuttle into the room before the door is closed
1211111122111221.content:
It is a fitful night of sleep that you 'enjoy', curled up like a dog (a half-inch tall dog, at that) outside his master's door. It's cold as well, and your dreams are haunted by distorted titans trying to catch and eat you.

The clacking noise of the monolithic door above you being unlocked awakens you, and you quickly get to your feet as it swings away from you, revealing Laura ready to leave.

Her feet - each with a different colour of nail polish - are clad in white sandals, her legs mainly bare below small white shorts. She's wearing a t-shirt of some description, but you can't make out much more as you strain to look up so high. She's swinging sunglasses onto her forehead though as she turns back to talk to her room-mate. As she does so she moves her feet a little, and you dive for cover as one swings carelessly near you standing place, impacting with a tremor.

"You sure you're not coming?" Laura shouts, even louder than her foot-stomp, even with the distance.

"I'm sure," comes a mumbled reply. "I think I need to sleep this hangover off..."

Well, one is staying in the room and one is setting off to campus. Again you have to choose between the pair, but which shall you go for?
1211111122111221.title: Hangover

choices: Laura stops at a cafe
Laura heads straight to class
12111111221112211.content:
After your great experience with Louise's feet last night, you've come to think of yourself as something of an expert at this sandal-riding lark, so you waste no time in clambering aboard Laura's while she keeps it relatively still. As an added bonus, with the sleep you've only recently woken from, you should hopefully manage to keep yourself awake throughout the journey this time!

You edge yourself cautiously around the mammoth toes, freezing occasonally as one of them flexes with car-crushing power, until you reach the natural gap between the biggest toe and its neighbour, further defined by the sandal strap running down. Sliding yourself in there and breathing in the heady musk of a healthy young foot, you settle down for the ride.

Laura's attempt to persuade louise to join her ended, she moves on, closing the door behind her. Once more you and your stomach are violently jolted with each step, but the rolling pain isn't so new to you now, and you hold your nerve. Still, it remains impossible to see exactly where you're going, so you'll have to wait until your carrier stops before you can get a lay of the land.
12111111221112211.title: Off She Trots

choices: You've come this far, may as well carry on
Tip the driver and move on to explore the cafe
121111112211122111.content:
The tormentous journey ceases eventually, and as Laura briefly pauses to survey her surroundings, you do the same. Chairs. Tables. Giants coming and going. Recognising the logo on the apron one of the serving-people is wearing, you relaise that your ride has stopped off at a local cafe.

More steps, each shaking you to the core down among her toes, take Laura across to a seat, and as her monstrous ass crashes down onto it, you wonder whether you should stick with her - scaling her body as she sits to make contact - or else spring for freedom and try to find another familiar face amongst the giants at the cafe. For one thing, if your friend Lisa is working today, you could get her help!
121111112211122111.title: Cafe Stop

choices: Wait in Laura's sandal
Head off to another person
121111112211122112.content:
The journey is longer than you remember - but then, you were asleep - and heads up and down more flights of stairs. Laura does tend to bound across roads in front of moving cars rather than wait for the lights to tell her its safe, and those are certainly interesting moments as you cling to her toes for dear life, the world dashing past you at an even more incredible rate, if one can imagine it.

But the journey does at last end, and no sooner have you caught your breath and settled back to lean against the mighty foot behind you than it is withdrawn, causing you to collapse onto the smelly sole of its sandal.

Coughing and spluttering, you look upwards to see the feet cheekily tucking themselves out of view underneath Laura's ass, as she settles down in a seat in a lecture theatre. You've been abandoned, cut off from human contact, so it would seem.

Or not. Other giants and giantesses are taking seats nearby, and many of them leave their feet on the floor, awesome structures that flex and crush with idle impatience.
121111112211122112.title: The Lesson Will Begin Soon

choices: Go to the toilet, to meet Louise now
Climb into Louise's bed, to meet her later
12111111221112212.content:
Screw Laura. She's the one that dumped you out here. Louise, on the other hand, deserves another chance. You dash through the door just in the nick of time, Laura closing it with near explosive force, sending you skidding along the floor into the room.

You dust yourself down, and look around the cavernous chamber. Louise is still in bed, probably buried under her covers, and so you can see very little of her. May as well make yourself at home while you wait for her to -

BLAM! She jumps from her bed and lnds so heavily that once more you are dashed down. As she stampedes away, you are kept in place, partly by the tremors carrying through the floor, and partly out of fear for being stomped. When both have subsided, you glance upwards to see Louise in her bathroom, lifting the lid on the toilet. Seconds later, you hear a torrent like a polluted waterfall, which can only be her throwing up into the bowl.

Looking away from the sight, you ponder the wisdom of approaching the giantess while she's in such a state, and instead look to her bed. Hmm, it seems that, when she jumped out so hurridly, Louise dislodged her bedsheets, leaving them forming a bridge from the floor to the surface of the bed. You could climb up there while Louise pukes her guts out, and meet with her in bed once she's done...
12111111221112212.title: She Shouldn't Have Drunk So Much Last Night

choices: Tickle the feet
Walk around her
121111112211122121.content:
You trek across the rainbow-hued rug, eyes fixed upon the back of the kneeling giantess before you. Her bare feet are the first part of her landscape that you near, soles skyward as she hangs her head over the toilet bowl.

Was it only the night before that these monsters carried you to this place? Now they look so helpless. Granted, each is several times bigger than a house from your persepctive, but by being at rest their fearful potential for mayhem is far at the back of your mind.

Looking up, past the toes and sole to the heel and ankle, you ponder your next course of action. Would it be a good idea to scrabble at Louise's feet now, in this moment of weakness? Or should you pull back from these potential stompers of your puny body and move around to her front, beneath her face, where she may well spot you in more friendly circumstances?
121111112211122121.title: If Only You Could Hold Her Hair Back For Her

choices: A door opens beside you
No one disturbs your trip to the party room
1211111122111222.content:
It seems like hours you've been trudging along - passing in pitch darkness past solidly closed fire doors that deny you access - by the time the hint of light and noise becomes apparant some distance ahead.

You would break into a run towards this nirvana if you weren't so tired, so instead you carry on trudging, the noise eventually resolving itself into loudly playing rock music. Sounds like someone brought the party home with them.

But since this is a student dorm, there's every chance that someone a door or two down is trying to study, and may take exception to the racket. Will anyone protest before you get into the light?
1211111122111222.title: Night Party

choices: Stay and observe the fall-out
Scurry through the open door
12111111221112221.content:
Just then, one of the doorways of the gods (as you've come to think of them) opens just to your right, swinging with enough of a breeze to pitch you off your feet.

As you are getting up, a flipflop-clad foot topples from the sky to land in front of you, shaking the floorboards with such violence as to knock you down again. Its noise is as nothing compared to the angry shout of the woman to whom it belongs however, raining down upon you like thunder.

"Could you guys keep it down in there? I have a big exam tomorrow and I need my sleep!"

A distant shudder alerts you to some of the party-goers putting their act together about coming out to talk with the woman. Do you want to stay and listen to the argument between these giants, or would you rather run in through the open door of tomorrow's exam-goer while you have the chance? After all, since she's so conscientious, she should be a good person to approach for help.
12111111221112221.title: Exam Tomorrow

choices: the giant spills his beer over the studious one
the two drunks attempt to drag the third off to their party
121111112211122211.content:
This should be good. Observing a god-scale argument will be an experience to tell the grand-kids about, that's for sure. Much better than your own grandfather's dated tales of WWII.

Approaching party-goers are already shouting out reproaches for the studier to 'get a life', and combined with the cacophony of their music and footsteps you have a hard time making out any details.

The tremendous feet belong to a man and a woman - one of each, both come to talk with the killjoy - and both pairs sway unsteadily as their inebriated controller attempts to maintain their equilibrium. The sober giantess stands steady as a rock, and it is close to her heel that you stay, in order to avoid being crushed by the unpredictable movements of the other two.

Actually, this isn't turning out to be as exciting as you'd thought. It's noisy, sure, but that's hardly a unique draw in this giant world. Maybe you should move on and leave them to it. As you come to this decision, however -
121111112211122211.title: Noise and Fury

choices: Her desk - an all-night cramming session resumes
Her bed - a good night's sleep before the big day
121111112211122212.content:
You run past the feet of the giantess into her welcoming room, noting at once how different it is from Laura and Louise's. For one thing, it's a single room. For another, it's scrupulously tidy.

If she's going to be having an exam tomorrow, then clearly the best place to be would be with her papers and pencils, so that you could accompany her there. Thus resolved, you set out on your long journey to the bag neatly set against one wall to your right.

Your journey is so long in fact that the woman enters again - door slammed shut behind her - long before you arrive. She strides across to her destination, compeltely ignorant to your presence.
121111112211122212.title: Too Late Now...

choices: Party on!
Not my scene
12111111221112222.content:
Closer and closer you get, the noise increasing exponentially with every tiny step. Eventually you emerge into the glowing aura that blasts forth from within the dorm room, and its truly like you have stepped before the gates of Heaven.

You shield your eyes for a moment and blink as you become accustomed to light again, and then you marvel at the spectacle that opens up before you.

Several gaints and giantesses laze about on the floor, while a couple gyrate to the music in the centre of their crude ring. You move closer, hiding behind a discarded beer bottle, and observe the mountains for a while, unable to make out the details of their conversations.

Do you want to get more intimitely involved with the party-goers, or would you prefer to watch from a distance, waiting until they sober up before making contact?
12111111221112222.title: Some Party

choices: ...Laura prepare to sit down on the bed - where you are!
Louise prepare to get out of bed - scattering you away!
121111112212.content:
You see an arm laid on Louise's shoulder. Your head still craned waaay back, you follow it across to see that Laura is comforting her room mate. She's dressed in shorts and a men's t-shirt, but still looks damn fine. Unspoken, your lesbian fantasies about the pair rear in your head again.

You can't make out what they're saying to each other, but you play out an idealised version in your head. 'Listening' to them talk dirty to each other distracts tou, meaning that you don't notice...
121111112212.title: A Room Mate's Comfort

choices: You end up in her ass crack.
You're pinned under one of her butt cheeks.
1211111122121.content:
You run as fast as you can to get away from Laura. But as she continues her move to sit down, her ass gets larger and larger. From your perspectve, it is now the size of an airship.
You continue to sprint, but her ass lands right on top of you.
1211111122121.title: Buns of Steel

choices: You crawl along the bed.
She moves for you.
12111111221211.content:
You're lucky. Even though she is sitting on you, you are in the gap between her buttcheeks.
Her shorts are loose-fitting, and the material is draped around you.
You dare not move, for fear of winding up as a splat on the bed, but eventually your realise you'll have to move somewhere, because you have no idea how long Laura will be sitting on top of you for.
12111111221211.title: Crevasse

choices: Try and get yourself out anyway?
Sit "tight", so to speak, and hope she doesn't scratch her ass befor
121111112212112.content:
As you lie there pinned under the fabric of her shorts, debating whether to make a run for it, she makes your decision for you and stands up.

Unfortunately, standing up requires pushing down against the bed, first, so you find yourself lodged in a small fold of her shorts. As the world seems to fall away when Laura stands, her ass closing on itself as she becomes upright pinches your body inside what looks like the biggest wedgie you've ever had the misfortune to be in.

Lucky for you, however, it's not a substantial one, and Laura makes no attempt to dislodge her shorts from her beautiful, full ass before walking over and flopping back down into her chair. Now, though, the act of sitting has squished you quite a bit more seriously, and you're in a very real danger of getting smothered, especially if she decides to settle her butt into her chair. The same forces that threaten to squish you between her asscheeks, however, make it very, very difficult to wiggle yourself out.

Do you...?
121111112212112.title: Bunched-Up-Shorts of Doom

choices: Get free and try and get the hell out of this linen cavern?
Find a safe place without leaving her bed?
1211111122121121.content:
The crushing shorts around you- not to mention your somewhat unenviable position lodged in the asscrack of a girl at the end of a long night- are making it more and more difficult for you to move, let alone breathe comfortably. You do your best to try and get yourself dislodged from the tight confines of Laura's shorts, and gradually you manage to get one arm free.

However, as you flail around, trying to find a place to grip, you only succeed in arousing the attention of the giantess that is unwittingly keeping you hostage.

Feeling a small tickle, Laura reaches down absentmindly, scratching her ass and tugging her shorts from her crack. From your vantage point in said crack, you see the monstrous form of her fingers come down alarmingly close to you, pressing into the flesh literally inches from your head.

Thankfully, you are spared an ignoble squishy death in the buttcrack of this lovely lady, since the act of her pulling her wedgie free has also freed you. Less thankfully, however, you did not fly particularly far. As a result, you find yourself trapped in a much tighter space when she shifts on her ass, pinning you tightly under one cheek.

You have not yet fully recovered from the strain of being trapped previously, and the incredible pain as the air gets crushed out of your tiny body by the force of her ass pressing down against you is unbelievable, and you black out.

Which, frankly, probably saved your life. Your unconscious form didn't use enough oxygen for you to suffocate under there. As a result, you come to an unknown amount of time later.

You find yourself still stuck in the fabric of Laura's shorts, however, she is now lying on her side in bed. Thank god she doesn't sleep on her back, eh?

The massive plain that is her mattress seems to stretch forever, and by your estimate it must be nearly a hundred feet to the "ground". You might not be able to ever make it out of her bed if she tucks the ends of her sheets in, but you're definitely in danger if you stay where you are, because God only knows how long it's going to be before she rolls over in her sleep.

Do you...?
1211111122121121.title: The Best Laid Plans of Mice-Sized Men...

choices: Jump for the shoe
Wait 'til morning
12111111221211211.content:
You're getting the Hell out of here, right now!

Of course, once you get a certain distance from Laura, you are forced to crawl beneath the bedsheets as if you were on an assault course. And, at your size, these sheets are HEAVY! By the time you reach the edge of the bed, you are utterly exhausted.

So when you look down the immeasurable distance to the floor, your head spins.

There's no way that you can climb down there now! If you weren't so tired, perhaps... But if you stopped here to rest, the giantess whose bed you share could wake up before you and accidently fling you to your death without you knowing it!

What a predicament.

Wait! One of Laura's discarded shoes is lying not too far from the bottom of the bed. It's not perfect, but if you jumped it would provide a relatively soft landing for you.

It's either that, or take your chances sleeping on the edge.
12111111221211211.title: Heavy, Man

choices: ...Laura putting her foot into the shoe
...Laura spraying the sole with some freshener
121111112212112111.content:
As you freefall, you feel like an action hero. However, not very many of those movie stars would be seen jumping from a bed toward the shoe of a female freshman.

You're on target, and impact within the heel section of the sneaker, rolling perfectly and taking no damage.

As you aclimatise yourself though, you begin to regret your decision. Laura has been up clubbing all night in these shoes, and her sweat-stench hangs heavy in the air, such as it is. You choke and gag on it, falling to your hands and knees.

When you get it into your head to try and climb free, you find that you can't bring yourself to so much as scrabble at the walls. You pass out from the toxic atmosphere, slumping down oblivious to the world.

You are only woken by...
121111112212112111.title: Smelly Shoe

choices: Run to the 'toe end'; enough room there to sit out the journey?
Press yourself against the heel end, and try to climb skin once the foot's in?
1211111122121121111.content:
That... that noise. What is it? You blink your eyes, then tear them open at the sight that greets you. The floor of the shoe is rumbling, and you turn your gaze skyward to see toes.

Toes, each one bigger than you, flexing in anticipation as they prepare to return to their home of the night before.

The shoe you're in.

The panic stampeding your brain is so overpowering that it does actually allow you a moment of calm and contemplation. You know perfectly well why Laura is putting on a sweaty shoe with no socks on her feet. When she goes to have a shower in the morning, she hates to have her bare feet touching the floor of the student dorm corridors and shower room, and it seems that these shoes are the nearest ones that she wants to wear for the trip today.

In the process of so doing, it seems as if she's going to stomp you to death.

You've got moments to react. Do you:
1211111122121121111.title: To the Shower!

choices: She thinks they're a pebble in her shoe.
She stopped for some other reason and ignores it.
12111111221211211111.content: You don't have time to contemplate this sort-of nonsense, you have to run! You sprint in the direction whichever wall is closest to you, and just in time, too, as her giant feet suddenly fill up the entirety of your shoe prison. Her toes are a foot (from your perspective!) away from pinning you to the wall. But for now, you take a moment to breathe. That moment doesn't last long, however, as your whole world begins to turn. She's started walking! Like a marble in a bag you suddenly fly into her pinkie toe, which is three times your size. You grasp her pink toenail and hang on for dear life, when suddenly everything stops. Uh oh. Did she notice?
12111111221211211111.title: Run to the 'toe end'; enough room there...

choices: Laura is called away by something.  You live.
Laura sprays you.  You die.
1211111122121121112.content:
You are woken by the shifting of the floor, rolling you about until you collide with a wall. You still aren't fully conscious of your surroundings as you hear Laura's godlike voice boom above you:

"Ew! That's rank! You want a whiff, Lou?"

Oh, so it's not just you, then. As the shoe is held aloft by Laura, it is constantly shifting, you have to fight to stay standing as you look upward, hoping that she may spot you.

The circle of light suddenly becomes host to a monstrous artefact, held in Laura's fingers. Cylindrical, it has a small nub with a black hole in it, with one of the fingers above that.

Oh, crap.

You run back as Laura presses down on the aerosol, spraying freshener in your wake. The improvement in the smell you approve of, but the fact that it could end in your death you find most distressing.

The toe-end doesn't offer any respite, however. As Laura tries to get full coverage of her sole, she tilts the show upward, while also wedging the can in the available space. The direction in which you're running soon becomes 'down', and you tumble helplessly, collapsing in a heap and seconds away from compressed death.

There's nothing you can do but pray to fate.
1211111122121121112.title: Aerosol

choices: North
South
12111111221211212.content:
You slump to the mattress from the shorts with a sigh of relief. You don't ever want to be in that situation again. Well, not at this size, anyway.

There are two ways that this 'minimum safe distance' thing could go: either you proceed northwards, towards the region of her head, or you tramp southwards, back towards her feet.

Option A means that you may be able to get her attention in the morning, and has the benefit of being almost totally safe from any night-time movements while you sleep. However, it does involve a long journey, which you may be crushed before you complete.

Option B is quicker, and you should similarly be able to get near enough to the end of the bed to be able to stay out of foot-kicking range. However, come morning you're likely to be trapped under the cover if you don't wake up soon enough.

What's it to be? You had best decide swiftly, for her mountainous ass looks ready to make another move...
12111111221211212.title: Polar Opposites

choices: squiggle out of her feet
stay where you are
121111112212112122.content:
You decide to go towards her massive feet. Besides, being next to her big head is way too dangerous.
You reach here massive soles. climb onto them, and suddenly she turns on her bed.
It happens so fast you, still stuck in her soles, gets flipped over and stuck between her and her bed.
Then, she is trying to get up.
Quick, you have to act fast.
Squiggle out of her feet to avoid the possibility of being crushed by her tremendous weight.
Or stay there in case she lies down again.
121111112212112122.title: South

choices: Hide and plan anew
Go over to Laura's feet
1211111122122.content:
Louise stands up. The sudden loss of her immense weight on the bed's surface rumbles across to where you are standing, and is enough to catapult you up into the air.

Your half-inch tall form seems to take forever to sail through the air, and in this world of slow motion you watch the two giantesses. Louise places her head on Laura's shoulder while the latter hugs her, stroking her hair in a comforting manner. Her gentle shushes are - to your ears - drowned out by the tempestuous sobbing of Louise. She took the loss of an eyelash rather harshly, you think to yourself, unless there's some other explanation. Perhaps the night's heavy drinking was done for some reason, and Laura is consoling her room-mate over some heartbreak or something.

The skyscraping forms of the two women begin to dwindle as your ultimate destination of the floor rushes to meet you faster. Soon it is just their perfect legs that you can see, forming a wall that you rebound off briefly on your descent.

You land, and immediately begin worrying. The fall wasn't hard enough to hurt you much - and your brief scrape with Laura's shin slowed you a little - but now you are down on the floor again, the feet of those women may be a worry. Louise is barely applying her weight to hers, since she's leaning on Laura so heavily, but still the imposing appendages move slightly from moment to moment, stomping down scarily close to your position. Laura's are more steady, keeping her in place, but you can sense the pent-up power within them as you look, and have no desire to get underneath them.

Looks like your plan to contact one of these women tonight is a bust; they're too caught up in their own issues to worry about yours. Or to even notice you. Perhaps you should run away now, find somewhere to hide and rest, and try again in the morning?

Alternatively, you could put your failure down solely to the fact that you chose Louise to contact. You were a fool! Laura is the more sensible one, and it is to she that you should go now. Since her feet are standing so still right now, you could try your strategy all over again with her.
1211111122122.title: A View from the Floor

choices: Food first, sleep later
Sleep first, food later
12111111221221.content:
You leave the giantesses to their business and rush underneath Louise's bed, hoping to have time to think and plot anew. The solid construction does at least muffle their voices, so that their asinine conversation dosn't disturb you. Looking over your shoulder, the only sign that they're there at all is the two pairs of humungous feet that stand steadfast like sentinels.

What to do, what to do? Clearly making contact with the larger outside world will be a lot more difficult than you had originally imagined, but now you're practically back to square one.

Well, almost. At least you should be able to get something to eat here, if either of the women leaves some crumbs from her meals on the floor. You can't be thinking on an empty stomach.

But should you venture outside to get a snack now, while they're active, or get a nap now and go to get food when you awake?
12111111221221.title: Hunger Strikes

choices: Unable to sleep, Laura walks to the desk to do some work
Louise moves to the desk to check herself out in the mirror
121111112212211.content:
While Louise is busy being consoled by Laura, the two of them should be stationary for quite some time: more than long enough for you to carry out a recee of the area and find some crumbs of food.

You take the long path out from under the bed, avoiding the feet entirely. Here there is just a great quantity of dust, none of which looks especially appetising. Once back out in the open, you keep your head down, afraid of looking up toward the distant ceiling and acknowledging just how tiny you are.

You pick around for a while, wandering around several pairs of discarded footwear and several other pieces of clothing, underwear included. You resist your baser instincts, keeping away from the building-sized bras and panties, other than to subject them to a cursory examination that confirms the lack of any crumbs near them.

You come at last to the shadow of one of the girls' desks, and your luck takes an upturn. They must eat while sitting here much of the time, and so the carpet around it is scattered with great lumps of unidentifiable foodstuff, some of which isn't entirely stale. You did in hungrily, completely forgetting about the two giantesses in the room with you.
121111112212211.title: Let's Eat!

choices: Approach Louise now
Wait for morning, go to sleep
1211111122122112.content:
No matter how absorbed you are in your meal, and filling your empty stomach, there's no way you could miss the tremors and noise that herald one of the giantesses approaching your position.

Turning, you see that it's nightdress-wearing Louise. She stops a considerable distance away (to you, at least) and proceeds to stand still there for long enough to wonder if you should make another attempt at contact...
1211111122122112.title: What's She Doing..?

choices: ...Laura putting a dust-buster underneath the bed: room inspection today!
Louise stepping out of bed with earthquake force
121111112212212.content:
Even though you did have that nap aboard Louise's foot, there's good reason to get more sleep now; if you can match the women's sleeping patterns, you can contact them when both of you are in an awake state of mind.

It takes a while when the shuddering steps of the women moving back to their beds - and especially the worrying creaking of the ceiling as Louise applies her weight to the mattress - keeps disturbing you, but once the three peole in the room have all settled down, you manage to drift off, content at last.

You are woken by:
121111112212212.title: Three Sleep as One

choices: Run away!
Run past it, to Laura
1211111122122121.content:
The rustling, roaring noise that drags you from your nightmares is like nothing else you've heard before, at any scale of your life.

Looking blearily in the direction it originates from, you see the wide open mouth of a dustbuster, clenched tightly in Laura's massive hand, being played back and forth across the carpet. And getting nearer to the bed under which you hide.

You could run, but you wouldn't get very far, you're sure; those giantesses can cover much more ground than little old you. Perhaps you should charge towards it, and hope to get past before it gets turned in your direction?
1211111122122121.title: Busted

choices: Walk back and forth on Laura's foot
Start slapping yourself in the face
12111111221222.content:
Yeah, Laura! She won't be one to freak out at the loss of an eyelash! She'd immediately realise what was going on and make contact with you, getting you back to the bar and salvation in no time!

Of course, to get to one of that beautiful eyelashes you're going to have to scale that foot...

Looking across at it, you can't help but be terrified by its scale and power. You edge closer, determined to use this moment of unusual stillness to catch a lift. No toe-clinging this time, though; you're going straight for the ankle.

You set your hands on the rough skin on the side of the foot, readying to pull yourself up after you get your own feet in there. The flesh beneath is warm to the touch, and the musky odour is almost erotic...

Still, you've got to concentrate! You heave yourself aboard the dizzying heights of the foot, feeling the blood rushing through the veins beneath you with all the force of a pneumatic drill. Leaning back against the ankle, you breathe a sigh of relief. Now just to wait for Laura to leave the crybaby alone and return to her bed...

While here, you take the time to look across at Louise's feet as they stand opposite. Wasn't that long ago that you were on them, enjoying the warmth and comfort of those toes, falling asleep among them...

No! You're not going to let that happen again! If you sleep, you could fall off and be crushed like a bug! No, you've got to remain awake, no matter what!

But it seems like those two could be talking for a while, so how best to stave off snoozing?
12111111221222.title: Sleep is for the Weak

121111112212221.content:
Yes, if you keep yourself exerted, then your brain won't have time to get tired and shut you down in sleep! You promptly begin marching back and forward across Laura's foot, little aware of the irritation you are causing the giantess in the process.

Her other foot moves across to hover above you, before dropping down to scratch at the irritation with toe-nails. Her biggest toe falls directly atop you, keeping you from falling asleep forever as it vigorously moves back and forth, simultaneously managing to smear your corpse across the top of Laura's foot and put a stop to the itch that was most distressing her.
121111112212221.title: An Itch That Just Has to be Scratched

choices: Stand up and wave
Run to her foot
121111112212222.content:
The first slap shakes your face, but then this proceeds to the rest of your body as the foot you are standing on takes to the air, at precisely the worst time imaginable. Completely unprepared and off balance, you fall from Laura and roll towards Louise as the comforter moves back toward bed.

Louise makes a small gasp. Lying on your back, you look up to see what has disturbed her. Having been so upset, her gaze has been downset, and so it shouldn't be any surprise to know that she has spotted you; even now his massive eyes - still huge at such a removed distance - are widening as they alight on your tiny form, and you wonder what form of action you should take now that a giantess is finally aware of you.
121111112212222.title: Cheered Up, Lookin' Down

choices: Louise pushes Laura away from you, and they both fall over
Louise toe-punts your puny form into a waste bin
1211111122122221.content:
The giantess steps swiftly away, rumbling the floorboards, and shrieking far above you: "Eek! A bug!"

You can hear Laura pausing in her regular tread to turn and venture back in your direction. Is this how it is then, betrayed even as you reach out to touch someone you thought a possible ally?

Then Louise's distant visage, to which you are still waving, changes its expression from disgust to confusion. "Wait - I think that he's waving at me..."

Yes! Now if only Laura cottons on to this before she steps on you. Speaking of which...

You turn to see how near she is, just to behold the scant light of the bedroom being snuffed out by her hovering foot. Looks like this is it...
1211111122122221.title: Wait a Minute...

1211111122122222.content:
You begin running for the immense foot of Louise, but in the time it takes you to get up a good head of speed it's already been withdrawn, moving back an incalculable distance with a single, crushing step. The floor vibrates, and the heavens are pierced by a cacophonous screech.

"Laura! There's a bug on the floor!"

You briefly consider piping up to refute that statement, but instead continue your all-out sprint, even though you know that there will be no sanctuary at its end; you just don't know what else to do.

Louise jumps away this time, both feet holding in the air for an impossible time before she slams down again, nearly deafening you and certainly halting your progress with the ensuing earthquake.

Then she's joined by the approaching footsteps of Laura, somewhere out of your field of vision. "Honestly, if it disturbs you that much Louise, just step on it."

"Ew, I don't think so!"

This is bad. You've got to get out of here before -

No more thoughts. Only the impact of the ball of Laura's foot, pressing down upon you with irresistable force and smooshing you to paste.
1211111122122222.title: Bug Similarities

choices: Shout
Quiet, like
12111111222.content:
In the folds of her hair, you begin scaling. The thick strands are thicker than your fingers, so there's not that much risk of them breaking under your weight. What little weight you have. Heh, if you get hold of that ring again, maybe you could use it to make money by selling a guaranteed method of slimming.

With no refunds.

Anyways, here you are, on top of her head. It's quite a rush, being at this height, looking down the trails of hair to the rest of her body, covered by the sheets. Just hope that she isn't restless. If she should roll over, you would be killed for certain. You approach her ear, and begin the laborious task and clearing aside the hairs that lie on top of it. Considering their length, you're lucky to get it done as quick as you did.

Once it's exposed to the faint light, you take some time to regard it. It protrudes a distance near enough to your own height from the head, and the bowl like depression over its walls is deeper than you can see. You stand on one of the many curving shelves within it and run your hands over another. Amazing. You'd never so much as glanced at a woman's ears before, but now...

Anyway. Now that you're ready to try and talk to this sleeping woman, how will you go about it? You could shout at the top of your lungs to jolt her awake, but that could result in her waking with a start and sending you flying across the room. Or you could whisper things to her subtly, hoping to influence her sleeping mind subliminaly. Course, with that method there's always the chance that she'll wake up and think it was all a dream. 'S up to you
12111111222.title: No Ear Puns Here

choices: You take a detour into her underwear
You press on towards her head
12111112.content:
Rumbling footsteps indicate that both women have now come out of their respective bathrooms (one each! In your day you had to put up with - but no, you're not going to get distracted now. And you're certainly not going to start talking like your father...), and at your size you can feel every tremor in the floor.

Laura is wearing a large t-shirt and pair of shorts, but form your angle you can't see what decoration is on them. It hurts your neck to look up any further than her titanic knees. You do, however, notice that her toenails have been painted red. Just like her, you smile to yourself, to do that when she was wearing trainers and no one could see them anyway.

Then you are running, in a hurry to get to her before she climbs the hundred and fifty odd feet into her bed.

With a leap you manage to clamber aboard the little toe of her left foot, and hold on across the one next to it. she wriggles her toes in response, probably a reflex action, and you find ypour grip tested. Thankfully, you weather the storm, just in time for the next one, when her foot is lifted onto the bed.

The leg swings over onto the bed, and you are thrown loose. You land on soft white surface without injury, but then the rest of Laura's body comes crashing down upon the bed.

You are buffeted around, and lucky not to be totally flattened under her bulk. Then everything goes dark. Looking up, you see that Laura has pulled her quilt over herself, nothing out of the ordinary, nothing to worry about.

You seem to have ended up pretty much where you began, next to her foot. Judging from its position, bearing in mind that it's dark, you judge that she is lying on her side. As you could never hope to lift the incredible weight of the sheet, you are forced to stick close to where she lies in order to keep under the tent-like space that spreads about an inch (her scale) from her.

You walk up her, rubbing one hand along her leg as you go. Its warmth and smoothness is a pleasure, and you start to think of one of the advantages to being this scale...
12111112.title: Laura

choices: She tries to grab you
She talks to you
121111122.content:
Avoiding the whole ethical problem posed by your situation, you keep outside of her clothes for now. Your progress, hemmed in on all sides by rough cloth, to light at the end of the cavern.

When you get outside, you see that it is a desktop lamp, shining light so that Laura may read her billboard sized book. Her face is totally absorbed in it, and while you are thinking of what you could say to her, you examine it in a level of detail you never have before.

Her mouth is pursed in the manner when she is thinking hard, or at least that is what you had always assumed. You are distracted for a moment by a sudden thought of how you would like to snuggle up against her lips for the night.

Her nose always looked a little pointy, but from this perspective you can see nothing wrong with it. It is perfection. Even the gentle breezes issuing forth from the tunnels of her nostrils is nice.

Then the eyes, above the plain of her cheeks. The irises are as wide as you are tall, and you could easily imagine yourself lost in them. Only when you notice yourself reflected in them do you realise that she is looking directly at you - she has seen you!

Okay, you've got her attention. The ball's in her court now...
121111122.title: Bedtime Story

choices: She eats you
She decides to insert you into a lower orifice
1211111221.content:
Laura, propped up on her elbows as she looks down at you, smiles her lips-no-teeth smile at you before closing her book, the breeze knocking you to the ground (ie the bed). Then her hand descends upon you, forefinger and thumb holding you in a rib-breaking grip. She lifts you closer to her face, where she looks you over carefully, and you yourself spot the gleam of cruelty in her eye that you'd never noticed at a larger scale.

This isn't good. You've seen those giantess stories on the web while idly browsing, and if they've taught you anything, then it's that there are only two ways that this could go...
1211111221.title: Cliched Giantess Episode Alert!

choices: Tell her the truth
Tell her that you're a magic pixie come to pleasure her
1211111222.content:
Laura, propped up on her elbows as she looks down at you, smiles her lips-no-teeth smile at you before closing her book, the breeze knocking you to the ground (ie the bed).

'What are you?' she asks, her unbelievably loud voice carrying even more force.

When you get back up, you shout your reply as loud as you can manage, but she just can't hear your puny voice.

She smiles again, her mighty eyes glittering down at you. 'Don't worry,' she whispers, keeping the volume of her voice down after seeing the effect that talking normally had upon you, 'I'm just going to pick you up.'

Her right forearm descends, the car sized digits of the hand coming to rest either side of you. As the thumb and fore finger close on you, their whorled surfaces getting even clearer, you take a deep breath. Laura is clearly trying to be gentle, but the pressure is still immense, the walls of flesh, blood and bone effortlessly lifting you to her ear. You look doubtfully into the dark cavern, hoping that from here she will be able to hear you, and that you won't have to climb in there.

But what will you say?
1211111222.title: Making conversation

choices: "Please, lets go back now!"
"I guess a few hours wont hurt . . . much."
12111112221.content:
Opening her fingers and letting her tiny passenger fall into her ear, Laura closed her eyes. She focused all her attention to the tiny - almost imperceptible - movements within her ear. She waited patiently for the tiny man to communicate.

Eventually she could just pick out a faint 'hello'.

"I can hear you - but just. Speak up."

The tiny man did one better. She could feel his movements - a slight prickling wherever the man touched her, or took a step. It was almost enough to be ticklish - but not quite. Laura sighed slightly. Still, she wished that either the man would be more careful, stop occasionally to scratch, or would get the hell out of the way so she could scratch herself.

Laura settled back onto her bed and took the torture. It was hard to believe that it was a mirco-sized version of a human was causing all this grief.

Suddenly a small voice broke the silence, causing her to jump. "Hello?"

"Oh my god - you are real." She said, sitting forward. "What are you? Who are you? Why are you in my bed?"

"The who and the what are easy", the voice began. "My name is John Stone. We've met before at a party last weekend over in The Mods."

"I'm afraid not. I'm fairly certain that I'd remember seeing a inch tall man at the party - and I didn't see you."

"I was much larger then - six foot one, to be exact. Black hair, shortly cropped. Skinny but not lanky? Remember me now?"

"Well, no - not really. There were a lot of people at that party, and I was pretty toasted." Laura tucked her legs under her Indian style. "So, how did you get in my bed?"

"The long version or the short version."

"The complete version."

"I was at the same bar you were at earlier this evening. Lying there on the counter was what only could have been a magic ring. Next thing I know *POOF* here I was, the size I was now."

"And. . . .?"

"I managed to avoid getting drunk and crushed, eventually landing near you. Desperate to survive, I climbed aboard and hitched a ride."

"On me?"

"Between your toes, to be exact. You have very hot toes, I might add."

Laura sat forward. She folded her arms across her chest, growing ever so slightly annoyed. "And you hung onto my foot all the way into bed?"

"Not exactly - not wanting to get flushed down the drain, I skipped the shower." Her face relaxed just a bit at that.

"So how much did you see?"

"Quite a bit, I'm afraid. But I was a perfect gentleman the whole trip up."

She leaned back against the wall. "I guess I can forgive you. I'd probably have done the same thing in your position."

"Thanks."

"Perhaps we can arrange a proper excursion later," she said with an evil smile crossing her face. "But first things first. What do you want to do? I don't imagine that you want to hang out in my ear canal for until this thing wears off, right?"

"We could go back to the bar. Perhaps the ring is still there somewhere."

Laura glanced at the alarm clock on the side of her bed. The red numbers rolled over to an ungodly hour of the morning. "It is 3 am, you know. They're not going to be open."

"Its worth a shot. The longer we delay, the smaller my chances of finding the ring become - no pun intended."

"Or we could wait until morning, consult with Louise and see if she has any ideas. She's a smart cookie, despite the surface appearances."

"I dont know . . . ." the tiny voice in Laura's head mused.
12111112221.title: The truth? What a unique concept!

choices: - she too is shrunk
- she hears a noise behind her
121111122211.content:
Quiet. All is dark, and nothing moves. The silence is broken as one of the windows, high up in the wall, snaps open. Then something large and black forces its way in, tumbling down to land in an undignified heap on top of the toilet seat. A few moments, and it has righted itself, holding a hand to its head.

'Told you that the restroom windows are never locked.' Laura says.

''Next time you can tell me that you're going to fall over, as well.' mumbles John, nursing his bruises inside her ear.

'Quit complaining, you should be grateful that I agreed to take you back here tonight. I need my sleep, you know.'

Now Laura is subconsciously brushing herself down. She is dressed in what she considers to be the perfect clothes for breaking and entering; black trousers, a black jumper and a black balaclava, rolled up above her ears so that John can breathe. The appearance is rather spoiled by the bright orange sneakers that she insists upon wearing.

Laura moves on into the main bar area, now totally deserted, chairs on top of tables. The light beam from her torch plays across the walls, the bar, the floor. Searching.

'It was on the bar, last I saw.'

'Yes, I see it now!'

Now the torch is fixed, concentrating on the gleam of gold lying in the centre of the bar. She advances towards it.

'It's right there? But it disappeared when I touched it! How did it get back? Something's wrong here...'

'Oh, be quiet, will you? We just got lucky. If you're going to complain, you can do it somewhere else.'

John falls out as Laura suddenly tilts her head, landing in the palm of her hand, soon to be deposited on the bar, alongside the torch. Guess I pushed her too far, he thinks, as he watches her psyching herself up for picking up the ring.

Laura reaches out a gloved hand to pick up the ring, and -
121111122211.title: Where It All Began

choices: ...shrank with Laura, meaning he's just as small next to Laura as before.
...grew back to normal as Laura shrank, laying unconscious next to the tiny girl
1211111222111.content:
Laura feels a tingling as she pokes the ring, and it begins to glow faintly. She shivers as she holds it in her gloved hand, and gently holds it over her other hand to show the miniature John. "See, nothing to worry about!" said Laura, smiling. "But now we have to figure out how to fix you." Laura carefully held it over her ungloved hand. "Maybe if I..." John let out a scream as Laura lowered the gigantic ring to where John was. He wasn't worried about it touching him - he was worried about it touching her. His words fell on deaf ears, though, as Laura poked her hand, and a bright flash of light was all they saw before the world went dark.

Laura grabbed her head and moaned. "Oh god...what did I drink last night?" she said, scanning her surroundings. "Wait...this isn't the bar." Laura's eyes suddenly lit up as memories of last night came rushing back. John, the Ring, the Flash of light...Laura put 2 and 2 together, and with a quick look around, confirmed her fears: She shrank just like John did.

"John?" yelled out Laura, looking around, scared. "John, where are you?" Laura was terrified. Her stupidity had endagered herself and her new friend. Looking everywhere around her, she finally gasped as she noticed John, as John...
1211111222111.title: - she too is shrunk

choices: She suggests something
You suggest something
12111112222.content:
The titanic fingers open, dropping you into space. It's a short fall, and you roll to your feet. A faint gasp escapes your lips. Standing up, you're dwarfed by the size of Laura's acoustical organ. The skin is soft and supple. you can smell a faint trace of peaches in the air.

Taking handful of steps forward, you speak firmly into the ear. "Hello! I am . . . um" you stumble for a name "Zelgadis." Yeah, that sounds appropriately fantasy-sounding.

No response.

Gathering up your courage, I shout. "HEY"

"I can barely hear you." Laura's voice rumbles from all around you.

Great, You think, as you shrug. No way am I coming this far, only to be stopped by a little thing like my size. Boldly, you walk into the depths of Laura's ear.

A few dozen feet or so into the canal, you began encountering a fine field of hairs, gentle and soft. Reaching out and grabbing one, running my fingers down its length, you quickly tell it has a vaguely plastic feeling to it - obivously from the wax all about you, no doubt. It's very firm, designed to keep dirt and other particles out. You brush them aside with ease and continued inward.

After the hairs began to thin out, and the buildup was left behind, Laura's ear canal narrowed around you. Gently running your fingertips along the wall as you walked, you could feel ripples in her flesh. You stop for a second, looking at the living ceiling above you. I wonder what this feels like - to have someone walking around inside your head. Knowing that it was a human being, causing nothing more than a faint tickle in your ear - understanding that nobody in human history could go there - a near microscopic person inside your head.

Cool.

Eventually the narrow tunnel of flesh opens up dramatically and abruptly. Before you was Laura's eardrum. The membrane was huge and her eardrum was thin enough to be almost translucent. I could feel vibration throught the drum - it was her inner ear's mechanics, moving in response to the noises all around her. Here's hoping that I could become part of that noise.

"Can you hear me now?"

"Perfectly!" she gasped out, clearly trying to deal with the tickle you were causing. "Who are you? What are you?"

"Well - you see," you say, settling down for a long talk, "that's a long story."

You can feel movement outside her head. You'd guess that she's sitting up. "Go ahead and tell me - I've got nowhere to go tomorrow and nothing to do. The night is all yours."

Well . .. . " you begin, trying to formulate a good story - but then anything coming from a half inch tall man is already scoring points in the fantastic but true category. "It's like this - you know all that Dungeons and Dragons fantasy stuff? "

"Know it - my ex-boyfriend was obsessed with that crap."

"Well, it's true - at least most of it."

"Huh?"

"Fairies, elves, pixies, dragons - the whole nine yards. It's about 85 percent real."

A slight laugh reverberates through you as she chuckles at the notion. "You're full of bullshit. You're having me on."

"Oh, sorry - I thought I was talking to someone with an open mind." You stand up, beginning to make for the exit. "I'll go find someone else's ear canal to walk around in."

"No, no - wait! I'm sorry." She hesitated. "I believe you." You crack a huge smile at that - the lie was working. "But if you're real, why have humans never heard of you."

"We tend to keep to ourselves now - anyway, how do you explain Easter Island and the Bermuda Triangle? What about bigfoot and the Loch Ness Monster - although she'd be very upset to hear you call her that."

"So what's your story?"

Anyway, I . . . . ah, it's a bit hard to put this, but - well, I was thrown out of society. Some might call me a rebel. A picker, a grinner - a lover and a sinner."

"What?"

"Stupid joke, never mind. So, like I was saying - they threw me out into the cold, hard world.

"They threw you out forever?"

It was hard enough scaling the sandal itself, but you're going to take this a step at a time. Firstly, you'll climb onto the top of Marsha's divine foot, and from there the leg...

Marsha is shuffling quietly now, and it isn't too much trouble to get to your feet, steadying yourself on her toes. At least you're still taller than them. Taking a deep breath, you pull yourself up, clinging onto the large strap that runs along the top of her foot from the ankle. There, the first step wasn't too difficult, you think to yourself as you make for the shelter of the ankle; a nice, soft and warm vertical surface to lean against, and something reassuringly familiar.

Now you can see where Marsha is heading, although each time her foot hits the ground causes your last meal to rise in your throat. She's going back to the bar, maybe to look for you. What will she do once she finds that you've gone?

Then you're rising again, pressed down by pressure as Marsha sits down on a stool, crossing the leg to which your ride belongs over the other. This time you do actually puke, a pitifully small pool on the summit of her foot. She wouldn't be too pleased.

Then things go black, and you are lifted up once again, even less gently. When the movement is over, the blackness divides before you, and you can see that you had been wrapped in a handkerchief by someone and picked up. No, not just someone, you realise as you gaze up in awe at the deity whose face is now the sky. Marsha.

You judge that you're now sitting in the palm of her hand, but you're more concerned with her face. Her eyes are lit up, her canyon of a mouth split wide open in a grin. She's happy to see you, you guess.

'So you did find the ring after all!' she laughs with a voice that threatens to destroy forever any hearing you may have had. 'Although I'd expected you to be more polite than to vomit over me to get my attention.'

'You knew about this?' you manage weakly, realising, even as you say it, that she can't possibly hear you.

'Oh yes, I knew. And I can hear you, too; when you can shrink matter, a simple listening spell is nothing.'

'So change me back!'

'Hah, it's your own fault. Any fool should have known better than to touch the jewel of a magical ring.'

She lets you see her other hand now, and you recognise the great black stone that sits upon a band around one of her fingers. She pauses to admire it for a few seconds herself, before continuing.

'It's nothing personal, you understand. And I'll prove it to you!'

The ground beneath you shakes as Marsha lays her hand upon the bar. Taking the hint, you drop from the hanky and onto the wood. You look back to see her withdraw her hand, winking at you as she turns to the guy sitting next to her.

'What's that?' he asks her, his confused eyes on you.

She shrugs. 'Takes one to know one.' she says flatly, raising her hand.

Oh god, you hope that you didn't look like that when you shrank. But it's not only the barfly that's affected; all around the monstrous chamber you can see previously eight hundred feet tall titans and giantesses convulsing and falling in upon themselves, disappearing to the floor beneath your line of sight. You even see Megan drop into the pool where she threw the drink that contained you. Only Marsha remains, a single goddess in a room full of insects. She is clapping her hands and surveying her handiwork, forgetting you for the moment.

Do you really want to remain here with the woman that you thought you knew, but now turns out to be some sort of sorceress? She is the only person who could possibly turn you back, but her recent actions suggest that she might not be in full possesson of her mental faculties. On the other hand, you could try and escape, find some other way to be restored, but risk her wrath if she notices. Whatever you do, you'd better act fast!
