She lay on the ground, whimpering to herself. Meanwhile, Meg and John continued to swim in her inner ear.

* * * * * * *

The veins narrowed, becoming one with Theresa's flesh. John reached the dead end, forcing his way through the corridor of flesh - Megan right behind him. The shaking came in pulses as he drew near to his destination - Theresa's ear. He desperately prayed that whatever was rattling him to the bone would soon go away.

It did not.

He climbed like that for what seemed like hours. Suddenly the world opened up into a new venue, spilling the two tiny endonaughts into a coiled duct with nerve fibers and specialized cells. In their scale, the tiny length of the cochlea - approximately 30 millimeters long, was huge. Beyond words. It was overpowering to their tiny selves.

Their presence did not go unnoticed. The pair shook, as they sloshed back and forth in the fluid. Eventually John swam to a tiny pocket of air.

He gasped in breath, despite his sealed systems. "Oh, thank god! I thought that ride would NEVER end!"

"I've seen more of my sister-in law in the last few days than I'll EVER want to again in my life." Meg dog-paddled to the wall. "Where are we?"

"I'm guessing somewhere in her inner ear."

"Wow," Meg whispered. "Do you think she can her us?"

"I hope so - that's the whole point of the three day roller coaster ride. Shall we?"

The pair let loose with the best screams and shouts their tiny lungs could muster. But . . . would it be enough?
121212111221112221122111.title: In her ear? Inner ear!

121212111221112221122112.content:
Swooping along through the stream, the microscopic endonaughts come to a area congested with red blood cells. Glancing about, John is confused - of the hundreds of miles the pair have traveled, this is an entirely new behivor. Something is happening, that much is for sure.

Megan starts tugging on John's sleeve, pointing frantically the way they had come. Propelled along with Theresa's heartbeat was a small cluster of white blood cells. Theresa may have not noticed the two tiny people inside of her - but her immune system most certainly has.

Growing anxious, the pair begin to swim downstream in the plasma, hoping to outrun the attacking cells. The extreme concentration of red blood cells however, prevents any movement. For every foot the two travel, they are pelted and slowed by the oxygen carriers. The white cells however, maneuver with ease. They thread their way through the biological obstacle course with grace and style. It would be an impressive show - if the two were not fleeing for their lives.

A protoplasmic tendril reaches for trailing Meg, wrapping itself around her ankle. She turns and tries to scream - tough to do in a stream of in plasma. She kicks wildly, trying to shake loose from the cell's deadly grasp. It is no use.

The blood cell flows up her leg as John draws closer to help. The cell begins to constrict around it's target - the perceived 'germ'. She writhes in pain as John tried to pry the mass free. He may be stronger than normal - but the immune system has had millions of years to evolve. He is just no match, as it flows up to her waist.

Suddenly, John is jumped from behind by another germ exterminator. It flows quickly up and around his torso. The sudden force separated the two, driving the lovers apart. Within seconds, the endonaughts are swept into separate arteries. The last sight John had of Megan was the cell flowing up over her head, Megan squirming in pain from the constriction.

Aided by several more of it's kind, the white cells grappled John, sending him to the same fate. The constriction, the pain . . . it soon became all dark. His last thoughts of his girlfriend, her body being flotsam in the blood of this girl forever.

Theresa walked into her bedroom, flicking on the lights. Kicking off her shoes into the corner, she dropped heavily onto her bed. Peeling off the outer layer of clothing, she lay back, eyes shut. As she drifted off the sleep - well, there would be no way for her to know that her immune system just killed her sister in law and her boyfriend.

John and Megan would never be seen again. . . .
121212111221112221122112.title: An unpleasant ending

choices: They are swept into her brain
The pair head for the tear duct
12121211122111222112212.content: The endonaughts continue on, swept into the left hand passage of a massive junction. John clutches Megan's arm for all he is worth as the next destination is upon them. . .
12121211122111222112212.title: One more decision . . .

choices: Start climbing
121212111221112222.content:
The pair twisted and turned in the wind, sailing for what appeared to be an eternity. Tom gazed out at the gigantic woman beneath them - she was tall - but then everyone is tall when you are a millionth of an inch yourself. A long mane of red hair reached the middle of her back, as she lay on her stomach. She wore an expensive evening green evening dress, cut from the ankle to the hip. Aside from sprawling on the couch, she looked elegant.

And they were descending right towards her.

A every so slight current of air altered their course. As Megan screamed, the bundled pair crashed into the soft surface of the leather couch - not the hard, back of the head landing that they were originally destined for. The impact was hard, jarring the two apart. John bounced, rolled and tumbled to a stop in a tangle of hair, while Megan sailed off into the distance, arms and legs flailing. John's skull connected hard with a strand of hair, reverberating throughout his body. Darkness claimed him, and he slumped to the ground.

He awoke to Megan's face, and a distant shaking. He was dimly aware of shouting, but couldn't make out the words. His eyes eventually focused on the Cheerleader's gorgeous green eyes. Suddenly the world returned to full volume, as sound came crashing in around him.

"John! Get up! Come on - don't do this to me!" She shouted, nearly in hysterics. "Don't leave me alone!"

John meekly held up one hand. "Ok - I'm ok. Please, stop shouting."

She did more than that. She instantly wrapped her arms around him and hugged for everything she was worth. A moan escaped his lips as the abuse, and she backed off. He slumped and fell backwards from the unexpected loss of support.

"Uhhhh - my head feels as if I've got a Frenchman living in it." He said, covering his eyes with his hand. "Are you ok?"

"More or less - I picked up some bruises and sprains, but it looks like the ring is good for taking care of that too." She flexed her right arm in demonstration. "It almost feels like new."

"I wish it would do something for this headache."

Stop whining." She said, helping him to his feet. He finally took stock of where they had landed.

By this time, the gigantic Theresa was fully asleep, on her stomach, head turned to face them. All around them was a tangle of hair as it cascaded off her head and surrounded her. It made the area smell faintly of shampoo. Her head was not more than half a mile away from them, so Theresa's majestic face dominated half of their existence. They could see the wrinkles in her cheeks, the eyes darting about under the closed eye lids, the twitches of her lips. Her nose flared in time with her slow and regular breathing. It was a symphony of tiny, gigantic movements.

John blinked. He *DID* feel better, even in the short time he had been on his feet. "So, shall we?"

"Shall we what?"

He turned to the tiny girl, gesturing to the mammoth one in the distance. "Climbing, of course. We have to get in touch with someone, don't we?" He started walking towards the larger woman.

The walk only took a little bit - a half hour tops. Eventually they reached Theresa's face, just above the bridge of her nose. At this scale, every imperfection, every flaw in the skin stood out like a beacon in the night. The very pores of her skin were deep impressions. The very wrinkles formed a stepladder stretching into the sky.

"Ladies first?"

"Age before beauty." She smirked, as John started the climb.
121212111221112222.title: It's Heads!

choices: Deeper inside Theresa's lung
1212121112211122221.content:
It was relatively easy going, as Theresa was not a tosser or a turner. Aside from the regular movements associated with her breathing, there was no indication at all that this was a human mountain. Within half an hour, they had reached the summit of the bridge of her nose. The slope of her snout stretched off at a gentle angle, allowing them to make better time as they climbed. It was still slow going - the pores forced constant detours across the landscape.

They were nearing the summit, at the point where the nose joined the cheek - when disaster struck. Over the course of the climb, the shrunken pair had grown complacent - which as any climber will tell you - that's when it's the most dangerous. A brief slip of concentration, combined with a cough from Theresa - suddenly Megan was falling. She plunged with a scream into the distance, only to be caught up in a sudden gust of wind - Theresa's breath. But instead of blowing her out into space, she disappeared from sight.

John was down the side of the gigantic face in an instant, nearly falling into the giant nose himself. "Megan! MEGAN!" he shouted - but with no response. Either she was too far away to hear and respond, of the roar of the wind was to great. He glanced around, over his shoulder. Theresa's lips were apart, a louder roar coming from them. [i]If this is her breathing through her mouth, I'd hate to see what a full on sneeze was like! [i]

John sighed - resigned to following his girlfriend. Climbing carefully down, he reached the edge of the nostril. Before him lie a dark humid cave hundreds of feet tall. Timing the gusts of wind, he slowly climbed into Theresa's nose.

He made is way further and further into the depth's of her head. All around him, a great forest of hair - thick and strong, reached into the sky. As he slowly picked his way through Theresa's nose hairs, he called for Megan. After what felt like forever - he heard an answer. Very faintly, in the distance - but it was an answer. He hurried his pace.

"Thank god!" she exclaimed. She hung, sixty feet off the ground, sweater caught on the very tip of a hair - either fixed by mucus, or snagged on the tip, John couldn't tell. He approached the hair, and begain climbing. It was slow going, considering the hurricane of wind that blasted him every ten seconds or so. As he neared the top, he heard Megan shout.

"Hurry! I think I'm coming loose!" He did.

As he neared the end of Theresa's hair, he stretched out his hand. Megan returned the favor, stretching as far as she could. Their fingers brushed ever so slightly as a gust of wind hit them, hot and humid from the depth's of Theresa's lungs. In one last desperate act, he lunged, grabbing Megan's wrist. The movement knocked him off balance - timed with the gust from the outside world, the microscopic people were torn from their perch. With another scream, Megan and John tumbled into the darkness and towards Theresa's lung . .
1212121112211122221.title: A breath of fresh air - sort of

choices: Try to get noticed by Tegan.
Climb on Tegan's sandal and hitch a ride.
1212121112212.content:
The humming grew more and more intense. John's teeth began to rattle, and it felt as if his fillings were heating up. Being shrunken - being eaten, that's one thing - but this, this is insanity.

He turned, looping his arm around Megan's waist. Just as a burst of electric blue light appeared on the platform, the shrunken pair dived off to safety. An electronic snap-hiss could be heard throughout the entire dorm complex as the mysterious machine melts down to a not-so-mysterious pile of goo. Sparks pop and fly from the remains of the machine as the humming dissipates.

Tegan appeared in the doorway, out of breath as if she had run back up the stairs. She quickly glanced around the room, seeing the smoking pile in the corner. "Holy Heisenberg! What happened?" She ran over, dropping to her knees. Scooping up the remains, she begins clutching the fallen machine like a slain infant.

Just a few inches behind Tegan's foot and slightly to the right, two tiny people extracted themselves from beneath some fallen rubble. Megan found her feet first, and crossed over to her boyfriend. She helped him up, as he crawled out from under a leaf of cardboard.

"What did you do THAT for?" Megan admonished, smacking him on the back of the head as he stumbled to his feet.

"What did I do that for?" he pointed to the titan before them, clutching the fused machine. "Look at it - that could have been us!"

"That or it could have worked." She shrugged, walking forward to the mammoth scientist. "Oh well, no point getting upset now."

John ran to catch up with her. "So where are you going?"

Megan came to a stop by the instep of the scientist's sandal. "I'm going to hitch a ride with someone who could possibly get us out of this." She reached up, grabbed the top of the sole, dug her feet into the rubber side and swung her legs up. "Coming?" she asked, reaching back for John.
1212121112212.title: Everything ends in 'Boom'

choices: The brother and the girl head right to the wine
The pair relaxes before drinking.
121212111222.content:
An evil smile crosses the faces of the two miniature people. Megan giggles, and grabs John by the hand, pulling him away. Within moments, the pair crossed the vast plain of the bed to the edge. Megan grabbed a handful of fabric and swung her tiny legs out over the vast abyss beyond.

She spoke as she began lowering her self to the ground. "So what' your story?"

Boring, actually. Just a 20-ish year old guy at college - same as everybody else. I'm - I mean I was working my way through a bachelor's degree in film and video communications." He paused, looking away momentarily. "Oh, and I have a confession."

"Ooh - confession is good for the soul. Tell me!"

"You wont be angry?" He asked, letting go of the fabric and dropping the final few feet to the ground.

"Of course not."

"It involves you, you know."

"The mystery grows deeper. Spill." She commanded, as she grabbed his arm and started trekking across the floor.

"Well, we had met at the bar earlier tonight - but not quite like I said."

"You were there? I didn't notice much."

"You wouldn't have noticed me - although I sure as hell noticed you." John smiled sheepshly

"What did you do? Were you a distant admirer or something?"

"No - you, um - well, I got drunk."

The two reached the far wall and the cabinet with the glasses. The first shelf was several feet above their head, and towered in the distance. This was going to be the tough bit. "It's a bar, silly - that's what you were supposed to do."

"No, I mean I was in the first beer you had this evening".

"Oh. Oh my." She looked down. "You were inside me? Wow." She motioned to boost her up to the next level. Moments later she rolled to her stomach on the ledge and offered a hand down. "So what happened?"

"I found myself on your floor after you took a turn at the porcelain god."

"Well, pleased to meet you, then."

"You're not upset?"

"Tell you what - you can make it up to me in about an hour."

They reached the base of the wine glasses, lined up along the bottom shelf of the cabinet. From there it was a short climb to the glasses, via the cloth backing of the drawer, and quick slide down the transparent surface. Megan let go, fell several feet, contacted the cold surface and slid to the bottom.

"Come on!" She shouted, waving at the still climbing John. Within moments, he let go, dropping to the bottom of the goblet. She gasps as the keys rattle in the door and the knob turns. . .
121212111222.title: A character building moment.

choices: Explore Theresa's insides. . .
Get some action of their own.
1212121112221.content:
Meg looked up, as the two giants entered into the room; one of them was her brother Gary - an young man of about 23-ish. - very handsome and strong. With him was a woman, obviously her fiancée. She was tall and very athetic, a long mane of red hair, reaching the middle of her back. She wore an expensive evening green evening dress, cut from the ankle to the hip. She kicked off her shoes into a corner of the room as she spun and collapsed onto the couch. Megan's brother crossed to the cabinet, and reached for the two wine glasses - and John and Meg.

John grabbed Meg and curled up into as tight a ball as possible, trying to look even smaller. Meg gasped as the fingers made contact with the glass. She watched in fascination as the flesh pressed flat and turned slightly white. But the examination was brief as a thousand pound weight was pressed down upon the two. The glasses lifted high into the air.

Within seconds, Gary crossed the room, placing the glasses on the low end table. He spun on his heel and exited the room to the kitchen.

The guy is obviously my brother." She said, nodding to the closed kitchen door. "The girl is Theresa Ashley Williams. I've only met her once before."

Theresa adjusted her foot slightly, her big toe mischievously touching the rim of the glass and rocking the container back and forth slightly. The pair could look up and see the vast collection of swirls on the bottom of the Theresa's toe.

John leaned back against the glass, looking directly up at the massive toe not but 30 feet from his head. "Playful, isn't she?"

"Yes. I wonder if we could get her to knock that off."

"Would you like me to climb up there and ask her to knock it off?"

There was no need. Moments later, the toe withdrew. Rummaging and cursing could be heard coming from the kitchen. Clearly Gary was having troubles with the wine.

John leaned forward, folding his arms across his chest. "So, I've spilled my heart out to you. You're turn - what's your story?"

In the space of a heartbeat, Megan went from friendly to quiet. "It's not important, now."

He didn't want to press. After a few long moments of silence, he decided to move ahead anyway. "I take it not everything is great at home?"

She nodded curtly. John slipped an arm around her shoulders. "You can tell me. I've been more intimate with you than anybody else." He said in a light tone. That got a slight smile from the girl.

"I don't have the lot in the way of friends. I'm not easy to get along with. I've leaded a sheltered life."

"I noticed that."

"What are they calling me now? 'Ice queen bitch'?"

"Ah - something like that." He took a deep breath before pressing on. "I think the words 'controlling, demanding bitch' comes to mind."

She moved away, every so slightly. "That's just it - nobody gets that it's the public persona. Daddy loves to look like he's spoiling me, treating me like a princess, so I have to smile and play nice. When we're behind closed doors, it's quite a different story. And then I get nasty rumors started by jilted boyfriends when I don't put out." Megan looked away, unable to meet John's gaze. "Am I perfect? No - but I'm not quite the monster everyone makes me out to be."

The moment hung long in the air between them Finally Megan spoke. "Listen - I don't know why I'm telling you this."

"Because I'm the only man who's been inside your intestines?"

She smiled, and shook her head, her blond hair spilling out behind her. "Let's not talk about it now - it'll just ruin the moment." Another total shift of mood in a blink of an eye - she was good at hiding behind masks, swapping them out at a moments notice.

Then the torrent of wine hit them.


* * * * * * * * * *


"Ta-dah!"

Greg finally emerged from the kitchen, victorious. A mangled cork in one hand, the open bottle of Riesling in the other - and a broad smile across his face. Theresa shot up excitedly, swinging her legs off the table. Greg grabbed the one glass, pouring himself a healthy shot of the wine. He leaned forwards, and unintentionally drenched his tiny sister and her equally tiny boyfriend.

Theresa leaned forward, gently picking up her glass. "To the future." She said, lifting her glass aloft. With that, she brought the glass to her lips, and drew a mighty gulp, downing the contents (Meg, John and All) in one go.

A split second after draining her goblet, Theresa began coughing. Moments later, the fit subsided. "Are you ok dear? "I think I felt something else go down with the wine."

Gary handed the mangled cork to her. "It was just part of this. I wasn't very gentle getting it out of the bottle, so I imagine that there is the occasional stray remnant. Pay it no mind."

Meanwhile somewhere deep inside Theresa's body, two tiny people . . .
1212121112221.title: Character Development - and ACTION!

choices: Torture Theresa with Tickles?
Explore the Endless Environment?
12121211122211.content:
Millions of gallons of white wine caught the shrunken pair off guard. As the Riesling cascaded around them, John lost his grip on Megan. Both were caught up in the current and swirled away from each other. As the flow subsided, the two bobbed to the surface. John started to dogpaddle over to his companion just as the glass was violently jerked into the air.

Meg reached for john's outstretched hand as gravity equalized itself. Their fingertips brushed as their world went all crazy again - and the two were separated. John barely had time to bob to the surface again before the world went dark. It was hot, humid and non-stop. The currents in the wine twisted and tumbled, sending the pair out of control, as powerful muscles guided their every move. He plunged down Theresa's throat first, screaming all the way - more like someone at the top of a roller coaster, than someone gripped by abject terror.

Megan was towards the end of the flow. She bobbed to the surface just in time to hit her head on Theresa's dangling uvula. Tiny face met slimy flesh as Megan instinctively reached out for support. Her fingernails dug into the meat, slowing her decent for only a moment. The suction yanked her away and she too plunged into the darkness below.

She tried to flail as she dropped, but powerful muscles squeezed from all sides. Moments later the meat tube opened up into a vast chamber. She rolled to a stop.

"Welcome to stop one of the Theresa Tour." John said, his arms spread wide. Above him, the majesty of Theresa's stomach towered.

Meg shakily got to her feet. "That was a hell of a ride. Was it this bad for you inside my stomach?"

"You were a lot more gentle. You sipped, she gulped."

Megan stopped short, listening intently. "Oh my god - listen to that!" She ran to one side of the chamber and placed her head directly against Theresa's stomach. "I can hear her heartbeat."

Then a revelation dawned on her. She sharply jumped back from the wall. "Do you think she can feel us in here?"

"I don't know - could you feel me?"

She looked sheepishly. "Well . . . no, but I was really drunk at the time." she reached out and touched the wall again. "I think I could have swallowed an elephant and not noticed."

"So, shall we look around?"

An evil smile dawned across Megan's face. "Want to find out if she CAN feel us?"
12121211122211.title: Going down . . .

choices: Theresa decided to ignore it, rolls over and goes to sleep.
She decides to investigate further by regurgitating the offending substance.
121212111222111.content:
"So, what do you propose?"

Megan walked to the wall of Theresa's stomach, flicking the lining with her index finger. No response. "I don't know - you have more experience at this than I do."

"Dear, I've only been inside one other person - and she could tell me as much as I could tell her." All further conversation was abruptly cut off as suddenly the stomach went all crazy. Theresa was moving. They could feel her leaning backwards, settling down on the couch. A few moments later, the landscape settled down.

Megan picked herself up off the floor, brushing herself off (a largely useless gesture - but more of a dignity saving one). She picked her way through the folds of the stomach, and stopped at the wall. She could just hear the murmur of conversation just outside Theresa.

"Hey! They're talking about us - well, me at least." Meg shoulder charged the stomach wall. "Hey! Yooo hoo! I'm right here! I'm inside your fiancée!" She started hitting the wall with her fists again and again - all to no apparent effect. The same steady heartbeat, the same intervals of rumble as air is sucked into Theresa's lungs.

After a few moments, the micro-cheerleader gave up, and collapsed to the floor. "Well, that was a bust."

John sat up from between two folds in Theresa's flesh. "So how would we know if she did notice us? What? She'd say hello?"

She rolled over on her stomach, looking John straight in the eyes. "Yeah, you're right - forget her - we'll try again later. Lets fuck."

* * * * * * * *


Finishing off the last of the contents, Theresa set the glass of wine down on the table. She slid back on the couch and swung her feet up onto the table, a wave of tiredness sweeping over her. Gary returned from the kitchen where he had just dropped off the bottle of wine.

"So I wonder where Megan is? She said she'd meet us." The man said, swirling the goblet of wine in his left hand.

"All her stuff is here, so she cant have gone too - " She paused. A strange look crossed Theresa's face.

"Problem, dear?"

She didn't respond. After a long moment, she shook her head. "It's nothing - just an upset stomach. It's gone now."

"You've had a long day - perhaps the wine is getting to you." Gary said, moving to the couch, and stroking the back of her head, her long red hair intertwining with his fingers.

She looked at the clock. "Perhaps you're right. I should probably go home. It's getting late anyway."

"Of course dear - you're nearly twenty-three now, it's way past your bed time." He said with a mischievous smile. "Old timers like you cant stay up as late as they used to."

"You jerk." She put her hand on his forehead and playfully shoved him over. "Just for that - no goodnight kiss."

With that, she slipped her shoes on, grabbed here coat and headed out into the hallway.

* * * * * * * *


"The car's stopped." John said, ear up against Theresa's stomach. The ground started swaying again as their host began walking. "Ok, I hear keys. There's the door." He scrunched up his face, trying to identify a sound. "I have no idea what that was - some sort of 'thunk' sound. That's defiantly a zipper and the rustle of cloth."

Megan lay between a fold of Theresa's stomach, on her belly, kicking her feet in the air behind her. "And? And?"

"Water, I think." A kind of oscillation ran through Theresa's entire body. "I think she's brushing her teeth."

A few moments pass without running commentary from John. Then suddenly, the entire world shifts 90 degrees. The two miniature people tumble head over heels in a flurry of 'oofs' 'ouches' and 'arghs'. They roll to a stop against the soft, yielding flesh. The only noise is the omnipresent heartbeat far above their heads.

"Yup - she' s in bed." They both say simultaneously.

* * * * * * * *


After brushing her teeth, Theresa crossed to the bookshelf in her bedroom. Grabbing a half-finished tome - a John Gardner spy novel, she walked across her room, sat on her bed. She flicked on the night stand light and lay down.

It had been a long, busy day - filled with a bunch of annoying, controlling people who insisted on getting their own way at the upcoming wedding. Mothers demanding this color, fathers insisting on this flower arrangement. It was a mad house she hated to put up with.

She sighed. Finally, her time was her own. She was completely, totally isolated - nothing to disturb her, no interruptions on hand. She'd disconnected the phone, the door was locked - she was alone.

Suddenly the flutter at the pit of her stomach was back again. She shook her head, tried to ignore the sensation, and went back to reading. The feeling came back again, this time much stronger. It felt as if a butterfly had been caught within her belly as was trying desperately to escape.

She set the book down, and pulled up her nightshirt. All she saw was her taunt abdomen muscles - certainly nothing that could be causing this. She shuddered, as the feeling started again - much stronger and this time more sustained. The feeling lasted for nearly thirty seconds, as opposed to the brief spurts from before.

Hesitantly, she placed two fingers against her stomach, just above where the feeling was coming from. Very slightly, very gently she pressed down.

Inside her stomach, the ceiling bulged in at Theresa's touch. John and Megan stopped their kicking, hitting and shouting. "That's it! She knows we're here!" John shouted as Meg leapt into his arms. They hugged and twirled for a moment, rejoicing in the moment.

"Quick! Lets do it again over here!" Megan shouted, dragging John by the arm.

The moment that Theresa pressed down, the tremble inside her stomach stopped. Mere seconds later, it began again - but not under her fingertips - but an inch and a half to the left. Reaching out with her other hand, she pressed down again. After a brief respite, the flutter started three inches towards her feet.

{/i}What the hell is going on here?{/i}
121212111222111.title: The Tickle Solution

choices: Catch the slow train to intestine-land -
A climbing trip is in our hero's future -
1212121112221111.content:
John and Megan tickled, poked and prodded their fleshy chamber for all they were worth. Meg used everything in the Official Cheerleader's Handbook to Jumping she knew - and some things she didn't know. John simply went six rounds with the stomach shaped punching bag. But despite their best efforts, the giant prodding fingers never returned. Finally, the whole stomach shifted to the left ninety degrees, sending the two occupants bouncing into the far wall.

"What the hell is the matter with her?" Meg said, kicking at the wall with her foot. "She *HAS* to be noticing this!"

John just lay on his back, staring at the ceiling, listening to the distant heartbeat grow slower and slower. The roaring sound of her breathes slowing, and becoming more regular. "Theresa must think that we're figments of her imagination or something."

"I'll give her figments!"

"You might as well give it up." He said, jerking his thumb over his shoulder. "She's going to sleep."

Meg sank to her knees and flopped on her back. "How could she possibly go to sleep with two teeny people constantly poking her from the inside?"

No response.

Megan rolled over to glare, but her boyfriend had fallen fast asleep.

She flopped onto her back, rolling her eyes. "How typical."

* * * * * * * *


"Morning sunshine!" Megan said, nudging the other occupant of Theresa's stomach in the ribs. "Time to get up!"

"Huh? What time is it?" John said, rolling over sleeply.

"6:45. Our gracious host has been up for half an hour already." She elegantly rose to her feet, walked several yards away from the prone man, and began stretching. "I swear, you could sleep through an earthquake."

"I think I just did." John stood and moved over to where his discarded clothing was. "So, what's she up too?" He asked, gathering up his sneakers and slipping them on.

"I don't know - I'm not that good at identifying the outside world through 10 feet of flesh." She said between bends. "Something to do with running water, I think."

Suddenly, the trap door just above Megan's head trembled. An inundation of liquid and solids erupted forth, squarely drenching the micro-cheerleader. John should have been concerned or worried, rushing to his girlfriend's side - yet all he could do is fall over, paralyzed with laughter.

All Megan had time to do was shriek in surprise before another flood of food drenched her. An errant chunk of sausage knocked her off her feet, sending her tumbling into the depths of Theresa's stomach. She rolled to a corner of the belly, coming to a stop half submerged in a pile of masticated eggs. She had rolled over and was pulling her legs out, when a mound of bacon came rolling down pinning her torso. Then a barrage of Orange Juice, topped off with some toast cascaded down.

In-between the constant stream of cursing, the sit-com moments and pratfalls, all John could do is laugh. It was like watching an "I Love Lucy" episode, but with gastronomical juices instead of chocolates. Meanwhile, John was relatively high and dry at his end of the stomach, away from the constant flow of chewed food.

"Thanks for the support." Meg growled as the laughter died away. "Do you think I could get a hand here?"

John started applauding. The clapping cut off abruptly as he had to dodge a thrown handful of eggs, lobbed by the food-covered cheerleader.

"Geeze, you dump a quarter ton of egg on a girl and she gets all upset." He mumbled as he waded into the waist high sea of dissolving food. He sloshed his way over to the half buried girl, and grabbed her arm. Bracing himself on the stomach wall, he pulled. Between the two of them, Megan managed to extract herself from the mound. As she pulled herself free, she violently jerked her arm away from John. Without the limb to hang onto, John found himself free-falling backwards. He landed in the ocean of nutrients with a *KER-PLUNK*.

John bobbed to the surface, to find Megan laughing at him. He began wading over to her. "Offhand, I'd say Theresa was making breakfast."

"No kidding, Sherlock." Megan grumbled as she climbed a reasonably solid pile of sausage and eggs. All around her, the walls of the stomach began to undulate and tremble.

"I don't know about you, but I'm happy for this turn of events." John said, climbing next to Meg.

"Why?"

"Because I'm starting to get hungry. The ring made us immune to loads of stuff, and gave us a strength boost - but hell if it didn't do anything for hunger."

Meg scrunched up her face and stuck out her tongue. "Oh - you're not serious!"

"She'll never even notice that the little bit we took is gone."

"*I'll* notice."

"Now how is borrowing a little food from our generous guest any different than, oh say spending the night in someone's stomach?"

"I wasn't thinking - it was my, um - gut reaction, I guess."

John dumped a fistful of goo on her head for that. The brawl quickly degenerated into a gastronomical wrestling match. Ten minutes later, Meg pinned John between a wedge of sausage and a stringy something.

The several minutes consisted of Meg at the dry end of the stomach sorting small amounts of food the best she could. She was fairly sure that bit was eggs. The mound next to it was gooey and damp toast. Several chunks of bacon were stacked on top of each other. It was slow going, considering the mound was being dissolved out from under her, and the now constant motion of Theresa's digestive process was designed to thwart just such attempts. Admitting defeat, Megan grabs a handful of undigested glop and sits next to her boyfriend.

"Stop delaying the inevitable." He said, biting off another mouthful of goo. "It's not that bad - well, relatively speaking."

"Relative to what?"

"Um - ah. . . well." He stammered. "How about that weather we've been having?"

She just shot him a sideways glance and ignored the comment. "So, you given any thought to how we're getting out of here?"

"Not yet. Have you?"

"Well, we can go along for the ride," she said, indicating the huge mound of food surrounding them, "or we can just climb out."
1212121112221111.title: Breakfast at Theresa's

choices: "You make the call!"
12121211122211111.content:
Megan wiggled her hips slightly as she forced herself through the door of meat that comprised the gateway between Theresa's stomach and her intestine. With a slight 'pop' she pulled herself free of the sphincter and rolled to a stop in the sagging tube.

Behind her, an arm thrust its way through the center of the ring, waving for help. A rumble resonated throughout their hosts' body. She had been awake and moving about, doing her morning routine for several hours now. They could hear her talking in muffled tones, as she orchestrated her wedding via the phone. Running water sound indicated that she was in the middle of a shower.

John pulled himself through into Theresa's intestine, falling into Megan's arms. He laughed at the ridiculous position they found themselves in as he stared up into her face.

Suddenly and electronic chirping filled the fleshy tube.

"What the hell?" Megan muttered rolling over onto her side and reaching into her back pocket. Grunting, she pulled out a small black device - a cellular phone.

"Holy crap! Where did that come from?" John asked, levering himself up.

She laughed, hugging her new boyfriend. "All this time and I forgot I had it!"

He returned the kiss, and broke apart. "Well, aren't you going to answer it?"

She blinked for a moment, with a quietly bemused expression on her face. "Oh, yeah."

Flipping it open, she brought it to her ear. "Hello?"

"Megan, where were you last night?" Her brother was on the other end of the phone sounded extremely vexed. "We waited at your dorm for over an hour, and you never arrived."

Bullshit, she thought. It was half an hour tops - period. Nevertheless she put a smile in her voice. "I'm terribly sorry, brother dear. I . . . I wound up meeting a most wonderful man, and we went out on an impromptu date."

Sniggers from the other occupant of the intestine nearly broke Megan's poker face.

Growing more angry on the other end of the phone. "Megan - I thought you had outgrown this irresponsible phase. I'm very displeased - and poor Theresa. She doesn't need this kind of stress before the wedding."

Meg slumped back, leaning hard into the soft flesh wall behind her. A gurgle of digestion activity rumbled throughout the tube as their air pocket moved just a bit closer to freedom.

A few moments after Theresa's gastronomical event subsided, Gary spoke up again. "What was that?"

"That? Oh, just a bit of gas." She snickered to herself. "Listen, I feel extraordinarily bad. What's Theresa's number. I'll call her myself and apologize."

"555-7759"

Megan snickered again, collapsing onto John's shoulder. "I'll give her a call right away - as soon as she gets out of the shower."

Gary almost asked how she knew Theresa was in the shower, but thought better of it. "I'll call you later this evening."
12121211122211111.title: Wrong number

choices: Tell her the truth - strange as it is
Lie like a rug
121212111222111111.content:
Theresa stepped out of the shower amid a swirl of steam and mist. She wrapped a towel around herself as her feet touched down on the warm shag throw rug on the bathroom floor. Her long hair was a ratty tangle of wet strands. She brushed them out of her eyes and quickly dried herself off.

Exiting the bathroom, she threw on a long flowing red dress, topping it off with a dark green sweater. She didn't care if the outfit was suitable for human consumption outside her home. It was comfortable, and that was all she needed.

She crossed to her living room and flopped in one corner of her futon. Curling her long legs up underneath her, she grabbed the TV remote and flicked it on. The DVD she was watching last sprang to life - an old copy of When Worlds Collide by George Pal.

Tucking the sun dress under her bare feet, she leaned back only half watching the movie. Finally - a brief moment of rest amid the chaos of her planning. The wedding was still a couple of weeks off, so she had plenty of time. No point putting it off until the last second, though.

She considered for a moment. Perhaps she was pushing herself too hard. She had spent most of the day with an strangely upset stomach. It was a unique feeling - unlike anything she had ever felt before. It came in spurts, like a fluttering feeling deep inside her. She hoped it wasn't an ulcer.

Her hand went to her abdomen subconsciously as the flutter returned.

Comments about strange upset feeling in her stomach all day long. Lies back and relaxes. Flutter again.

The movie - and her musing - was interrupted by her phone. Shifting slightly, she picked up the cordless extension.

"Hello?"

The voice on the other end sounded strange, yet familiar. "Hi Theresa, it's Megan."

Theresa sat up sharply, sliding forward to the edge of the couch. From the other end of the phone, sounds of commotion could be heard. She sits up. A look of confusion crossed her face. Of course, she could have no idea that the call was coming from inside her own body.

"Oh, it's you." She said coldly.

"Look, I'm very sorry that I skipped out on you guys."

"I don't need this kind of stress this close to my wedding, thank you very much. Be dependable, or be gone."

"I can only" - the rest was cut off by a rumble - like a freight train passing in a subway. She took this brief pause to reflect on how hungry she was. As soon as she was rid of this distraction, she would make lunch.

"I didn't catch that. What did you say?" Theresa asked.

"I said I can only say sorry so many times, you know."

Slightly satisfied, she sat back. "OK - this is your chance to make it up to me. Where did you go? What happened to you?"
121212111222111111.title: Reach out and touch someone.

choices: Theresa believes them -
Theresa thinks they are full of it -
1212121112221111111.content:
Meg looked apprehensive at her boyfriend. "Where did I go? Well, your not going to believe the truth. . . ."

"Try me."

She shrugged. "Ok, here it goes. I've been shrunk by a magic ring to 1/4th of an inch tall and I'm currently in your small intestines."

There was a long silence from the other end. "What?"

"I said that I'm -"

"I heard you the first time. That was the polite way of saying 'your full of bullshit'"

She stood up and started pacing back and forth - to the best of her ability in the uneven, fleshy tunnel at least. "Well, you see the story all started when John -"

"Who the hell is John?"

"He's the other person residing in your digestive system. Anyway, John found a magic ring that shrunk him to about 1/4 of a inch tall. He wound up hitching a ride home with me when I went home. When I got home, I wound up being shrunk by the same ring." She looked at John, "Letsee what happened after that. . . oh yeah, we got eaten by my cat, ejected from same, cleaned up, found the ring again - it didn’t work this time, however. We thought about making contact with you and my brother - but decided that it would be more fun to get swallowed again."

"You did what?"

"Yeah - so we hung out in your glass last night. You drank us with the wine and your body has been processing us ever since. And here we are."

There was another long pause. "Are you drunk?"

"Well, in a matter of speaking yes - but not in the way that you're thinking. Didn’t you comment last night that it felt like you swallowed a bit of cork with the wine? Haven't you been feeling strange movement in your stomach, like you haven't been feeling very well?" She leaned back against the wall. "That was us crawling around inside you."
1212121112221111111.title: Megan tells it all

choices: Let Theresa's body do it's work and go along for the ride.
Hang on, resist the regurgitation, and continue exploring Theresa's insides.
1212121112221112.content:
The stomach rocked again, as their unwitting host rose from her bed. As the motion settled down to the gentle swaying accompanied when someone walks, John crawled over to Megan.

"So - what do we do now?"

"What do you mean?"

"What would you do in her place? If you felt unexplained movement inside your stomach?"

"Investigate, I guess."

"Right - probably in the most expedient way possible, tossing her cookies." Suddenly millions of gallons of water came crashing down through the trap door leading to the esophagus, flooding the chamber. Several times, the flow stopped briefly, before starting up again. Within moments, the stomach was half full. "The question is - do we go along for the ride, or do we stay put?"

"Don't you want to get saved? Get back to normal?"

"Well, yes - but this has been the best vacation of my life - with my new girlfriend, to boot. Were you serious when you were trying to get her attention, or were you just fulfilling your fantasy roll playing the part of the annoying gnat fluttering at your ear? The gnat doesn't want to communicate - it just wants to have fun."

The stomach rotates ninety degrees again, as Theresa lays down, preparing to expunge you from her body. The moment of truth is at hand!
1212121112221112.title: Theresa gets fed up

choices: Theresa is sympathetic to John's plight.
Theresa is hostile and uncaring (and potentially violent?) to him.
12121211122211121.content:
Megan grabbed John's arm. "Lets go - I'm tired of touring my super sized sister-in-law. I want to get back to normal."

He nodded, knowningly. "Ok, hang on then - this is going to be rough."

The water began churning and heaving, tossing the tiny couple as they cling to each other. A deafening coughing/hacking was heard from far above, as Theresa focused all her attention on her stomach muscles. The walls collapsed, the chamber tightened. The agitation grew worse, and suddenly the water level of Theresa's stomach dropped. The shaking intensified, the rumbling grew louder and louder - and suddenly, there was a thrusting movement. The pair was dumped into Theresa's esophagus, where the squeezing and churning strengthened. Megan felt as if she was going to be crushed and torn apart at the same time.

The water surged forward again; the pair tumbled out into Theresa's mouth. The pressure was finally too great, and the micro-lovers were torn loose from each other's grasp. John sailed out of Theresa's mouth in a graceful arc, landing in the bathtub far below. Megan wasn't so lucky, finding herself wedged in-between Theresa's tongue and her back teeth. The flow eventually subsided, and John comes to a rest near the plugged drain.

The pretty face of Gary's fiancée dominated the sky far above him - the first time John's gotten a good look at her. Her eyes, vaguely glazed over from the recent ordeal, were a beautiful hazel. She had a round face, dotted with freckles. If he had to pick someone's insides to explore, he could have done much worse.

As she slowly and cautiously wiped off her mouth with the back of her hand, John looked around for Megan. Despite the enclosed area, she was nowhere to be seen. He glanced over at the drain, realized that the giant stopper prevented anything from progressing downwards. He looked up - she still must be inside Theresa!

Far above the tiny John, Theresa's eyes finally focused. She sat back on her legs folded under her. She took a deep, deep breath - trying to clear the palate from the nasty taste of her stomach. She was so focused on the squirming in her belly - or lack thereof, that she didn't notice the unconscious lump in her mouth under her tongue. Shaking her head to clear it, she cast an eye back to the contents of the bathtub before pulling the plug on the drain.

She almost didn't see the tiny man, as he waved his arms franticly trying to catch her attention before she swept him away to oblivion. She blinked once, hand on the drain stopper - then she blinked again. She had trouble believing what her eyes were telling her.

"What the hell?"

John waved, smiling as broadly as he could.

"What - what the hell are you?"

"Hi - I'm John." The blank expression on his face told him she was unable to hear him at all. "Nope, I didn't think so" he muttered to himself.

He waved her closer, motioning to the ground by lowering his hand. It took a few minutes to get the point across to pick him up. A dawning crossed her face and she extended her hand to him. He walked over to her massive hand, the tip of the finger about twice as tall as he was.

"Damn - now that's a big hand."

Looking over his shoulder once, he reached out and grabbed onto the tip of Theresa's index finger. The fingerprints before him stretched skyward like a flesh stepladder. The 'rungs' of the ladder were soft and springy to the touch, yet surprisingly firm. John quickly scrambled up Theresa and scurried to the center of her upturned palm. Theresa's giant brown eyes took in his every move.

The heat coming off her palm was surprising - it was more pervasive than he would have expected. He cast his eyes to the ground, the vast field of lines before him was beautiful and captivation. The fingers curling over in the distance looked like might skyscrapers - and hammered home just how fragile he and Megan were. He flexed his hand unconsciously.

He turned and motioned with his hand to the side of his head. Theresa blinked. He repeated the motion a couple of times, pointing to the giant. She nodded and raised her hand to her ear. He walked to the edge of her hand, took one look at the ground below, and leapt into her ear.

He landed softly within the concave folds of Theresa's ear. He sighed, moving forward.

A few dozen feet into the ear, he encountered a field of hairs - much like tall grass. Reaching out to touch one, it had a delicate feel yet very firm. It (and the hundreds others just like it) was clearly designed to keep dirt and small objects out. Well, this was one small object that would not be denied. He brushed them aside with ease and continued inward into Theresa's ear canal.

Eventually the hairs began to thin out, and the faint wax build on the surface of Theresa's skin was left behind. The ear canal began to narrow slightly. A few dozen feet more and the narrow tunnel of flesh opened up. It was a small chamber just big enough to stand up in. Before John was the thin membrane of Theresa's eardrum. The eardrum was huge, yet thin enough to be almost translucent. It was cool and smooth to the touch.

"Um, hello. How are you?" he eventually said.

The booming response came from all around him. "Wow - you ARE real. Who - what are you?"

"My name is John, and boy do I have a long story to tell you . . ."
12121211122211121.title: Leaving Theresa

choices: And then down he went. . . .
121212111222111211.content:
Consciousness slowly returned to Megan. Her eyes fluttered open. The first sensation that she was aware of was that it was very warm and extremely wet. Her eyes focused on a large wet red wall dominating her view. All around her, she felt movement - from the wall, from the hard things she lay upon, where she was at - where am I at? she wondered as she pressed her fingertips up against the wall inches above her.


Suddenly she remembered! This is the underside of Theresa's tongue! Those hard things jabbing in the back were Theresa's molars! The events came flooding back to her, how John and her had managed to convince the giant to toss her cookies - and them, up. She must have gotten lodged somewhere on the way out.

Trying to move as little as possible, she rolled over. Her hands sunk several inches into Theresa's gum line as she tried to wiggle out from underneath her tongue. She managed to find a gap where two gigantic teeth met - not quite large enough to slip through, but just large enough to move upwards. She squirmed between the hard wall of enamel and a thousand pounds of muscle, rolling over onto the top of Theresa's tongue. She turned around to face the mouth just as the opening widened. Seconds later, billions of gallons of water flooded into the chamber, sweeping her into the darkness and back down the throat.

"Aw crap! Crap, crap, crap!" she shouted, pounding her fists in tiny anger as she rolled to a stop inside Theresa's stomach.

* * * * * * * * * *


Theresa tied her robe as she walked out of the bathroom and crossed to the kitchen. She pulled a tall glass of water, hoping to kill the nasty taste of bile in her mouth. Downing the large glass in one go, she walked into the living room.

"So, John. I bet you have an interesting story to tell me." Theresa asked, sitting on the couch.

"Well, see I was at the Blue Parrot club two or three nights ago." John began, while settling in and leaning up against the wall of Theresa's ear canal. "I wound up being shrunk there."

"How?"

"You know - I'm not quite sure. A magic ring, but I don't know more than that." John paused, uncertain.

"What's wrong?"

"Um, it's a little disconcerting talking to a wall of flesh that's suppose to be you. Hang on a second." He reached into his inner jacket pocket and pulled out his ball point pen. Clicking the end, he began to draw on the flesh directly across from him.

Theresa almost fell over from the amazingly light tickle coming from the inside of her head. It was all she could do to keep from scratching madly or laughing - both would be bad for her microscopic guest. "Wha - what did you just do?" she managed to finally gasp out.

"I'm sorry - I drew a smile face on your eardrum."

Theresa just laughed long and hard at that.

After a few moments, John continued. "Anyway, I wound up hitching a ride home with - oh dear.

"What?"

"Where's Megan?"

"Megan?"

"Gary's sister - you swallowed her as well! We were together when we came up - she must be inside you somewhere!"

"You mean like right now? There's someone in my stomach at this exact moment?" She smiled. "Cool."

"So we were at Megan's dorm room when, she touched the ring and shrank too. She must have picked it up at the bar or something. We tried to get the attention of either Gary or you from the wine glasses - and you wound up the lucky winner. And here we are."

Theresa had gotten up from the couch at this point. She was too excited to sit still, and so paced around the room. "So, what do we do now?"

"We have to find Megan, get the ring back - and then . . . I don't know. First things first."

"So, how do we get her out?" Theresa smacked her lips subconsciously. "I'd prefer not to heave again - I'm still getting rid of the nasty taste from the first time."

"I could go get her, and then we climb out ourselves."

"That should work if I lie down and don't swallow." She moved her right hand to her left ear. "Ready when you are."

John stood up and traversed the ear canal once again. He looked up as he walked, running his fingers along the ceiling. This is way too much room in here. I have to be smaller than the original 1/2 inch estimate. he mused as he walked along. Passing through the field of hair he moved into the shell shape of the exterior ear. Beyond was the vast horizon of her massive palm. Stepping carefully, he moved onto her hand into the center of her palm. He was unready for the sudden motion as Theresa brought her palm around to her face.

"When you get her, poke me as hard as you can. After that I'll lay down and try to keep from swallowing until you are out, ok?" John jumped up and down and waved his arms in response.

The hand moved closer to Theresa's mouth as she stuck her tongue out. The tip overlapped the palm by several feet, allowing John to safely climb on. The muscle retracted and he found himself in darkness again.
121212111222111211.title: Making contact at last!

choices: Scientific approach
Mystical angle
1212121112221112111.content:
John rolled to a stop inside Theresa's belly - and at the feet of his girlfriend. "Not that I'm upset to see you, but what are you doing back here?" she inquired, helping him to his feet.

"Well, I made contact - and she seems willing to help us."

"That's great!" She leapt into his arms with a squeal, knocking him to the floor. "So how do we get out? The same way as before?"

"No, we climb out." he said between kisses. "We poke her, she lays down - and we simply walk out."

John stood and walked to the stomach wall. He pulled back, to let fly his fist - when Megan caught his arm. "So she knows we're in here?"

"Yup."

She smiled with a wicked, mischievous grin as she pulled him closer. "You want to have one quick go around, then?" She asked, in a low libidinous voice.

Theresa's stomach rumbled slightly as if in response.

"Wellllll - OK, since you insisted."

* * * * * * * * * *


" You took your own sweet time. What were you doing in there?" Theresa asked as John and Megan walked down her ear canal.

"Hey - you have a big stomach. It's dark in there!"

"I thought I felt an awful lot of movement in there. Are you sure?"

Megan tittered slightly as John attempted to keep a straight face. "No - positive. What would we be doing inside a stomach anyway?"

Theresa decided to let whatever it was go. She flopped onto the couch. "So - back to your place to get the ring. Then what?"

"My father knows some people at the university. He's donated enough money to the science wing that someone there owes me a favor." Megan offered, settling to the floor of Theresa's ear.

"It's not the sort of social circles you tend to run with, my dear, but I know a person who's knowledgeable about the occult." Theresa countered. "She's very good."

John pondered for a moment. "Why don't we go with the . . ."
1212121112221112111.title: Inside Theresa - Round Two

choices: The two hours pass uneventfully
Something bad happens
12121211122211121112.content:
The door to Ray's occult shop swung wide open, a faint tinkle of a bell marking the entrance. The inside of the shop was long and narrow, the walls lined with dusty, ancient tomes. The air was slightly tainted with the smell of incense, masking the dust smell. A large black and white cat lay sprawled on a stack of books two feet high. He looked up as the female human entered, but instantly deemed her unworthy of giving him attention. He went back to sleep.

Theresa wandered through the maze of bookshelves to the back, her tiny passengers safely tucked away in her left ear. She looked at a handful of the the titles as she passed. "Tobin's Spirit Guide", "Walberg's Book of Magicians, Martyrs and Madmen. ", "Roland's Encyclopedia to Ancient Sects". The titles went on and on.

Eventually she mad her way to the back of the store. The owner - Ray, was a medium build fellow in his mid forties, with a hairdo that looked like it was a spiky, dead hedgehog.

"Anita in?"

"Humph?" Yeah, she's in the back." He mumbled as he gestured over his shoulder.

She walked back to find a short girl, about 28 or so, sitting behind a desk. She looked up from a big, thick book much older than she was. "Theresa! How are you!" She exclaimed, coming around the desk for a hug. "What brings you by?"

Theresa held out the ring, wrapped in a cloth handkerchief.

Anita's eyes widened. "Oooh - fourteenth century, European design - no, wait - defiantly Russian." She gazed at the black stone. "Pearl stone, gold inlays - and probably about a four point four on the Psychokenitic energy scale." She sat down. "Where'd you get it?"

"A couple of close friends found it, and fell into a bit of trouble - "

"You could say that." Megan said. Theresa just rolled her eyes and continued.

"- and they were wondering if you could find anything out about it?"

"Yeah, I got a couple of angles I can check out." She reached out and took the ring. "Gimmie a few hours, and I should have something."

Theresa nodded - but Anita was already lost in work. . .
12121211122211121112.title: Stepping Into the Twilight Zone

choices: The deadline is 24 hours
The deadline is 72 hours
121212111222111211121.content:
"Good news - I found out all the background and history about your mysterious ring." She said, handing it to her, sans napkin. Theresa balked, recoiling from the tainted object "Don't worry - it's safe enough for the moment."

"So what did she find out" Meg said jumping up and down.

"And?"

The Cursed Ring of Alkazar comes from the middle east - which is why I mistook it for Russian. The two styles are very similar around that period in -"

"What about the ring!" The two shrinkies shouted at Theresa.

"The ring?"

"Ah - right." She dropped a heavy tome onto the table in front of Theresa, a large picture of a Indian temple on the right hand page. "In 1463, Lord Felton the mighty received this cursed ring from Alkazar the Black Knight - and was never seen again. The ring disappeared for several centuries until 1717 in Spain" She flipped forward to a majestic looking Spanish lady holding aloft a character of the very same ring. "Apparently it was instrumental in the disappearance of several high court officials." It vanished again for years - then the Nazis were said to have it. Although Hitler was big into the occult, I think this one was just but a rumor."

"The ring was said to reduce people. Some say it stature, some say physically. Nobody knows for sure." She closed the book. "And now you have it."

"Can she unshrink us?" John demanded. But before Theresa could ask, she was cut off by Anita.

"So tell me just WHY are you so interested in a ancient artifact of unspeakable power?"

"Perhaps I should show you, instead."

Anita watched with fascination as Theresa reached to unhook her earring. When her fist came back, instead of a diamond stud in the palm of her hand, sat two very tiny people. Meg waved to the giant set of eyes far above her. The eyes blinked in amazement.

"Wow. I guess that means the second set of people were right." She leaned in closer. "May - may I touch them?"

"If it's OK with them, sure." A round of nods came from the two tiny people. Anita held out her hand next to Theresa's, keeping it as steady as she could. Megan was the first across, stepping from Theresa's hand to Anita's with a light spring in her step. John crossed moments later, much less enthusiastically.

"Wow - they're so tiny, I can barely even feel them."

"Just wait until they start marching up and down your ear canal. Then you'll feel them." She dug the index finger into her ear and scratched as hard as she could. "So, they've been eager to know if you can get them back to their former height. Actually, they've been very insistent."

She brought her hand up to the level of her eyes. "Actually the process is very simple, as far as mystical rituals go." The diminutive leaped into the mans arms, and they both fell to Anita's palm rolling around and laughing. "Before you two get too excited, there is a catch. There's a deadline to reversing the effects. If the ritual isn't completed by the deadline, the effects are permanent. . . "
121212111222111211121.title: The Cursed Ring of Alkazar

1212121112221112111211.content:
Megan collapsed, as if she had been hit in the gut by a shotgun. John just lay there in the palm of the giant hand, his eyes closed. 24 hours was yesterday. If we hadn't messed around inside Theresa. . . . He was completely unaware of the movement, as Anita offered her hand to Theresa. She very gently reached out, and picked up the two shrunken people, cupping them in her right hand.

The long silence hung in the bookshop's air. Theresa finally spoke. "So, what about the ring?"

"The ring can be rendered harmless - all it needs is an owner to bring it under control. With it bonded to a master, the ring can be used at will."

"I see."

"Sorry I couldn't have been of any more help."

Don't worry about it - you did all you could. Thank you for your time." Theresa said quietly, as she turned and exited the bookstore and into the cold dark night beyond. . .

POSTSCRIPT


Despite the lack of a cure, life went on as normal for Megan and I. We stayed with Theresa, with her keeping us a secret from everyone - husbands and wives, girlfriends and boyfriends, police, parents - everyone. Eventually, the giant world moved on with their lives.

Theresa did eventually take possession of the Ring of Alkazar, gaining full mastery of it's vast power. She's even figured out how to shrink objects and clothes for us - no longer were we forced to wear the same thing day after day. Eventually she figured out how to shrink herself to our scale, so me and her finally have had a proper meeting face to face.

Theresa's wedding eventually came and went, with two extra guests in the front row of the church. Since we were destined to spend the rest of our lives together, we exchanged vows also. It didn't mean anything in the eyes of the law, but between us and before whatever gods are out there - that was all that we needed.

"So, honey." Megan started, as we leapt onto the gigantic passing bride amid the shower of rice, "Where were you thinking of going for our honeymoon?"

I rolled onto my back, watching the vast sky above us go by. "Well, I understand that Theresa's intestines are lovely this time of year", I said with a devilish grin on my face. Megan just grinned and gave me a warm passionate - and sloppy - kiss . . .
1212121112221112111211.title: A missed deadline - and a happy ending

1212121112221112111212.content:
"The process has to be completed within 72 hours. How long ago where you two afflicted?"

The shrunken pair didn't bother answering; their words would have been lost on the giant anyway. Megan landed a huge kiss on the man - he had at least 6 hours before the deadline, and she had nearly 12. He returned the favor, picking her up, twirling the micro-cheerleader around. He tripped on the lifeline in Anita's palm, a huge gash across the relatively even surface of her skin. The two tumbled into a heap, near the base of her thumb.

Anita watched the two's reaction. "I'll take that as a yes". She turned to Theresa, sitting across the table, offering her hand back. "Here, keep an eye on these two while I get to work. I shouldn’t been but a moment." As the pair jump from one plane of flesh to another, the gigantic woman set about her work.

John pulled Megan to her feet, walking down Theresa's palm, settling at the base of her middle finger. All the while under the gigantic eyes of the redheaded woamn. "So what do we do?" He asked, leaning back against the wall of flesh behind him.

"What do you mean?"

"I mean when we get to normal. Does everything go back the way it was?"

She leaned in close, putting her arm close around her boyfriend. "I don't think so," she said with a kiss.

Suddenly a torrential rain storm poured down on the two, breaking the embrace. John's head snapped around, looking at the skyscraper sized woman across from them. She held a small perfume atomizer, and was currently spraying the two (and Theresa's hand). She smiled and grinned, slightly shrugging. "Sorry - part of the ritual."

Anita continued to light candles, wave incense and so on. "Ok, I'm nearly set. For this part," she said pointing to Megan, "you . . .um, ah . . . "

"Megan" Theresa offered.

"Megan, you get to play the big roll in the drama here." She grabbed a book of a nearby shelf - a dusty old tome, and began flipping it open. "For some reason or another, only a female can properly harness the ring. Why - don't ask me, I just read the books."

Theresa interjected. "Then what?"

"Well," she said addressing Megan, "you have to assert your will on the ring - some sort of mental dominance to show it who's the boss."

The tiny cheerleader looked confused. "Just think happy thoughts. All the hocus pocus makes it seem more scary than it really is. You'll do fine." She nodded for Theresa to lower her hand.

The pair walked to the edge of Theresa's palm. By this time, they had gotten used to traveling on a moving mountain. Creases in her skin were easy to avoid, the pulse of her heartbeat was simply another rolling feature of the landscape, the pores were a simple matter to work around.

Megan lowered herself first, using the folds in Theresa's tan flesh as handholds. Swinging his legs out over empty space, John followed suit. The pair stepped off onto a purple felt surface, with some sort of writing and/or runes on it. What exactly, they were not in a position to tell.

Anita sprayed more of the foul smelling stuff on the ring, and placed it several dozen feet (their scale) away to their right. "Any time you are ready."

Two sets of mammoth eyes watched as Megan walked over to the ring, a hesitation in her step. She looked into the deep black gem as she approached. The blackness beyond twilight lay within - it was damn creepy. She stretched out one lone hand, laying her palm flat against the facet, filling her mind with happy thoughts as she did. Then, an atom bomb went off in her head, a flash of light filling her vision - her mind.

And all became dark . . .

121212111222111211121211111211.content:
It wasn't long before Britney was enjoying the Hawaiian weather, soaking up the sun in a pair of denim cut offs and a bikini top. The man sitting opposite her was clearly not finding the sun quite as much to his taste; a wide brimmed hat was rammed on his head, and he wore a ridiculous looking macintosh, buttoned up so that all that could be seen of the man inside was the bridge of his nose, and the madly staring eyes that sat either side of it.

'You're sure that the Ring is coming here?' Britney asked quietly, emphasising the capital letter.

'My sources have never been wrong before.' the man assured her, his voice thick with an unidentifiable European accent.

'So why is it that you need me?' Britney asked brightly, taking a sip of lemonade from one of the three brightly coloured straws that were in her glass.

'I'm sure that I've explained this to you before.'

'Well I forgot, so explain it again.'

'Very well. The Ring was crafted centuries ago by the last sorceress to live, and she enchanted it so that only a woman could use its power - any man touching it would suffer from its baneful effects. It was a lot of trouble to go to to acquire it simply to protect a treasure map.'

'But you want it more for the world domination aspect, right?'

'Precisely. But for the cursed circumstances of my gender, it would already be mine, but instead I've had to nurture you, raising you as a woman fit to be my vassal, to bear the Ring in my name!'

'But I can have a little fun too, can't I?'

'But of course...' smiled the man, his eyes glittering as they caught the sun before he lowered them into shadow once more.

***

After an uneventful flight, John and Megan were ready to enter their hotel. Still airsick, John decided to forgo the traditional threshold carrying of the new wife.

'Well, it's not perfect, but it's as good as could be expected on your finances.' Megan announced after a look around the main room.

'I'd forgotten that you were used to the finer things in life.' John mumbled, dumping the luggage onto the floor.

There was a knock at the door.

'Answer it, would you?' came Megan's voice from the bathroom.

'You should really have gone on the 'plane.' John admonished her, opening the door back up again.

'You know tha-'

It all happened at once. Megan screamed, and John was thrown back as a large man in a dark suit and sunglasses burst in through the door. Dazed, he looked up to see a pistol pointing at him. And Britney Spears.

'What the fuck?'

'Sorry about this, but I believe you have a Ring that belongs to me.' Britney smiled.

'The ring? Why should I-'

'I'd think carefully before you answer.' Britney said, her eyes raising from John's prone form.

John turned his head, still mindful of the gun, and saw Megan being taken out of the bathroom, another besuited man holding one arm around her throat. The other arm pressed a gun to her temple.

'I'd hate to see this new marriage get off to a bad start.'

12121211122211121112121111121111.content:
As the sun gradually set over the horizon, it cast a yellow glow over the whole island. After a couple of hours, Megan returned with a basket full of edible flowers and other tasty fauna. By then John had already set up the camp, a lean-to nestled in a grove of luscious palm trees.

The crackle of the camp fire and the constant roll of the surf was the only sound for miles. The only sign of civilization was their camp.

It was, in short, paradise.

Suddenly, a spear landed at Megan's feet, kicking up a plume of sand. John jumped to his feet to face the threat. He was met by several native tribesmen exploding out of the bushes around them. They wore primitive rags for clothing, bore shells and bones for jewelry, and all carried obsidian tipped spears. In short, it looked like something off a Gilligan's Island episode come to life.

It took John a few moments, but then it dawned on them - all the warriors were women. Not a man was to be seen amongst them. Megan obviously caught this fact too, as she glanced out of the corner of her eye at John.

Within seconds, the lovers were surrounded. Then, a warrior - the leader of the hunting band - stepped forward. She was fairly pale skinned, much less than what you would expect. She had long black hair tied back into a functional pony tail. She was of course adorned with the animal skins and bones of her fellow hunters. "Greetings outlander."

Well, that wasnt what I was expecting, thought John.

"You were expecting some uncultured primitive dialect, perhaps?" the native said, clearly reading the surprise on his face. A six year doctorate in Psychology and Parapsychology at college - I only choose to live this way out of respect for my culture."

"So now what?" Megan asked?

"Well, you've violated our sacred ground, and broken several tribal laws. Now we take you back to the village where we force you to have ritual sex with everyone in the tribe before sacrificing you to Kho'Lani the Volcano God."

"You're joking!"

"Oh no - I'm serious. Like I said - I'm respecting the traditions and ways of my people."

"By feeding them to a volcano god?!?"

"We all have our parts to play."

Megan leaned in closer to her husband, whispering into his ear. "Should I use the ring to get us out of here, or do we play along for now. They may know something about the treasure."

We have a high-tech metal detector, that will be able to find it, which worked on the ring that we have right now. I say we shrink these jokers and get the damn ring and get away from these damn islands."
